However, she does not realise he is becoming dangerously obsessed with her, constructing elaborate hiding places to spy on her. His behaviour becomes increasingly sinister, and her reconciliation with her ex-boyfriend drives him into a murderous rage. Horror, with Hilary Swank, Jeffrey Dean Morgan and Christopher Lee

programme.desc: An enigmatic stranger offers to read the fortunes of five men he meets on a train, leading to a sequence of twisted tales. A werewolf prowls a stately home, a man discovers his new bride is a vampire, a living plant envelops a house, a musician dabbles in voodoo and a disembodied hand menaces an art critic. Compendium of horror stories, starring Peter Cushing, Christopher Lee and Donald Sutherland

programme.title: The Blood Beast Terror (1967)
programme.desc: A 19th-century police inspector investigates a series of strange murders, with the victims all drained of blood. His efforts to crack the case lead to a scientist performing genetic experiments, whose daughter has been transformed into a giant moth. Gothic horror, starring Peter Cushing, Wanda Ventham and Robert Flemyng

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Smiler begins attending a poetry group and is inspired to write verses for an enchanted Marina. When the two go to the meeting together, an anxious Howard needs to find a way of keeping an eye on them without being seen - and Truly claims to have the perfect solution

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The penultimate episode sees the retired detectives investigating possibly their most difficult cold case yet. A bloodstained bust is uncovered during construction work in a cemetery and the evidence points to the murder of an alternative-medicine practitioner seven years earlier. Further clues lead to the controversial world of cryopreservation - the practice of keeping clinically dead patients frozen to extend their life cycle. Sasha is determined they don't put a foot wrong - but with the sobering possibility that two perpetrators are still at large, the detectives are forced to go out on a limb

programme.title: Silent Witness

Nikki investigates a man's apparent suicide and begins to suspect foul play after two more deaths occur, leading to recently released mental patient David Nicholson being accused of their murder. programme.desc: Alex creates a stir by broadcasting a book review show on Lochdubh's pirate radio station - but TV John senses a dark cloud is about to blot out the shining sun of literary appreciation. Sure enough, as the authorities take steps to stop the illegal transmissions, Hamish faces an agonising crisis of loyalties. Whimsical drama, starring Robert Carlyle, Ralph Riach and Valerie Gogan

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part two of two. While in Venice investigating his friend's death, Lovejoy discovers that not only is the beautiful Caterina saving art for herself rather than posterity, but so too is her sister Lavinia. Fulton Mackay, Gwen Humble and Haydn Gwynne guest star, with Ian McShane

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Andrew tries to convince his friend Ronnie Neale that he has a serious illness, an unenviable task at the best of times and one complicated by the prospect of losing Dawn to her estranged husband Keith. Meanwhile, confusion abounds as Sam and Joanna are called out separately to the same patient. Starring Gary Mavers, Haydn Gwynne and Sarah Parish

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: The staff at Bayview Retirement Village are sent into a panic when Diana and Tom head off to Brighton for the day in a borrowed Porshe without telling anyone. Comedy, starring Graham Crowden and Stephanie Cole

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher takes on the role of agony aunt and ends up writing letters home for his fellow inmates - but he soon discovers domestic problems of his own when his daughter brings bad news on visiting day. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Patricia Brake

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Truly discovers a former suitor of Marina's went off to Australia, and convinces her the emigrant did so to forget about her - and that she should stop seeing Howard out of respect to the other man's memory. Long-running comedy series, starring Frank Thornton, Jean Fergusson and Robert Fyfe

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Auntie Wainwright is thrilled to have picked up a bargain at the auction rooms, but puzzled as to what the object is. Worse yet, when she does find out what her purchase is meant for, she still has no idea what to do with it. Long-running comedy series, starring Jean Alexander, Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A man is murdered at the unveiling of a new church clock and the cleric must act quickly before an innocent woman is sent to the gallows. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: Sister Boniface and her father play a dangerous game when they investigate suspicions of espionage at a chess tournament

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Pilot episode of the crime drama, starring Amanda Redman as Superintendent Sandra Pullman, a rising star of the Met who is sidelined after a failed hostage rescue. Put in charge of a new department, she is dismayed to discover the unit is to be manned by a motley crew of old-school former detectives who know little about modern police procedure. However, when they re-examine the case of a man whose conviction for murder 20 years ago has just been overturned, their combined experience and unorthodox methods bring interesting results. Alun Armstrong, Dennis Waterman and James Bolam play Redman's veteran team, with Jon Finch, Tim Woodwork and Philip Bretherton

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team takes on three cases at once in-between major murder investigations. Harry deals with a hit-and-run on a council estate, Leo investigates the cause of a fire that left a woman dead, and Nikki is called out when a bride-to-be collapses and dies on her hen night. Starring Tom Ward, William Gaminara and Emilia Fox

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Sahira tells Hanssen that he may not have been Reyhan's only victim, leading the great surgeon to become distracted while operating on her father. programme.desc: Phil ropes Ritchie in to dig up dirt on George's missing wife and Suki convinces Nish they need to sack Eve. Keanu realises Finlay's car was deliberately damaged and Ben backtracks on having Lexi live with him

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team mark National Windrush Day by restoring items that celebrate the Windrush generation. Beverley comes into the barn with a British passport issued to her father in Jamaica in 1948 which served as his legally binding document to come to the UK to help rebuild after the Second World War. Keithly brings in a suitcase used by his mother that holds memories of her journey from the island of Nevis to the UK in 1956. Brother and sister duo Dorcas and Stephan bring a precious clock for the attention of horologist Steven Fletcher, it being the first item their parents Hermann and Keturah saved up to buy after arriving in the UK from Antigua. Patrick Vernon OBE brings with him his British-Jamaican Second World War veteran father's radiogram for repair

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: In Art Week, the sewers start by make a skirt inspired by the Modernist movement. In the transformation challenge, the contestants are given canvases painted by local art students and turn them into dresses, making use of the sculptural fabric and painted design. For the Made to Measure challenge, the sewers take inspiration from the 20th Century Surrealist movement to create fantastical outfits for a mind-bending catwalk

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Staged
programme.desc: The gang try to pinpoint where it all started and what went wrong. Georgia spies an opportunity as both David and Michael worry the other prefers working alone

programme.title: Staged
programme.desc: David and Michael try to break the standstill on the project while Simon tries becoming a dentist after giving up writing. Georgia's efforts turn manipulative

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Adventurer Bear Grylls traces his ancestry, starting by exploring his paternal army-serving grandfather Ted Grylls' old trunk, intriguingly full of documents marked 'Top Secret'. Next, Bear wants finds out more about the life of his beloved grandad Neville. His father - Bear's great grandfather - is revealed to be a loving family man and progressive headmaster who modernised Harrow School. Bear eventually traces the family line back several centuries revealing, to his delight, Scottish ancestry. A trip to north of the border uncovers the story of Bear's 10-X great grandfather, the Duke of Argyll

programme.desc: A chef who makes a bogus claim by exaggerating his injuries finds himself in hot water, and a dodgy driver who stops his car in the middle of a roundabout is caught out on CCTV

programme.title: Dirty Rotten Scammers
programme.desc: A man who lost £14,000 from his accounts after clicking on a link he believed to be from an online auction site. Presented by Michelle and Mavis Ackerley

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph patrols Altrincham recycling centre in Greater Manchester, hoping to find three items packed with potential and give them the chance to shine once more. She finds a pair of folding chairs, an old washstand and a collection of glass bottles. Upholsterer Simion Hawtin-Smith and upcycler Sarah Parmenter set to work helping Jacqui transform her finds

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonli Shah helps a Nottinghamshire couple find a new home in Argyll and Bute. The host also tries out paddleboarding and seaplaning

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Originally from India, Bindu grew up with a garden full of vegetables, nature and birdsong and would like to recreate a bit of that in her modest garden in Warrington, Cheshire. The garden is a sun trap, so she and partner Vivek want some height and shade in the plot as well as raised beds for fruit and veg growing. It's very important to them that they try and care for the environment too so would like the means to harvest rainwater and compost waste. With a relatively small budget of £3,000, Charlie Dimmock and Lee Hull create a garden that is both eco-friendly and looks beautiful

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team arrives in Kent to help a busy family of four whose members have recently converted their garage into a wet room, but now lack storage room. In just 24 hours and on a limited budget, they convert the original downstairs toilet into a store cupboard and build clever seat storage in the family room

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The truth about what happened to Rose Knight is finally revealed

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: Mark Wright, his brother Josh and father Mark Sr head to Northumberland. Mark Sr regales his sons with facts about Hadrian's Wall, local castles and the origins of Earl Grey tea. The history buff is in charge of choosing the night's accommodation and picks rooms in 800-year-old Chillingham castle - which Mark Jr is horrified to discover is reputed to be the most haunted castle in Britain. The next morning the trio partake in a little coasteering, which involves climbing up and down the rocky shoreline and jumping off cliffs into the North Sea. The visit ends with a relaxing trip to a spa

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Elaine and Paul in Mickleover, Derbyshire, love all things 1950s - be they cars, clothes or music. Elaine also loves fairies. On a budget of £3,000, Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull create a garden inspired by the rock and roll era that will also make the couple's fairy-tale dreams come true

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Kevin Clifton, aka 'Kevin from Grimsby', is proud of his northern roots, but wants to investigate a long-standing family rumour from much further afield. According to his father, the Cliftons might be related to a mysterious woman called Matooski from the First Nations of Canada. This takes the dancer on an extraordinary journey to the country's remote 18th-century trading posts. The trek reveals that he comes from a long line of skilled and courageous female ancestors who survived - and thrived - against the odds

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: Naga Munchetty revisits more shocking stories from the archive, including the men who made millions by deliberately causing car accidents, endangering innocent lives. Plus, how the so-called victim who claimed an accident had left him terrified of heights blew his claim out of the water when he posted pictures of himself at the top of Europe's highest water slide

programme.title: Dirty Rotten Scammers
programme.desc: A woman who clicked a link she thought was from her phone company, which led to her losing out on big money. Presented by Mavis and Michelle Ackerley

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts is in the Cornish village of Blackwater to see a three-bed detached bungalow with an exterior that reminds him of a Battenberg cake. Tommy Walsh is in Wandsworth, south London to visit a large period property split into three separate flats and an eyewatering guide price of over £1million. Martel Maxwell takes a trip to Bilston in the West Midlands, where a three-bed semi with a rather large driveway catches her eye

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley presents the contest from Hemswell in Lincolnshire. Experts Izzie Balmer and Mark Stacey help guide the Red and Blue teams to a prime purchase in a bid to make the greater profit at auction. Caroline also pays a visit to the Lincoln Castle Victorian Prison

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades is at Altrincham Recycling Centre on a mission to rescue and revive unwanted items. With two eclectic skip-finds to transform, he turns to designer Sarah Peterson to update a side table and chest of drawers. Jay takes on four dining chairs as his own creative project. Narrated by Arthur Smith

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Denise Nurse visits the coastal county of Cornwall, helping a couple to turn their favourite holiday destination into their permanent home on a budget of £475,000. Away from the search, she visits a new development that's tackling the county's housing crisis by prioritising the needs of local Cornish people

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Angus wants a garden that reminds him of his favourite holiday destination, Cyprus. Currently he hates his awkward shaped plot and absolutely loathes the domineering dark grey retaining wall, which he thinks makes the space look like a prison yard. Angus loves to barbeque and entertain friends so would like a generous Cypriot-inspired space in which to do that and is also keen to try to grow his own produce. Lee Burkhill and Flo Headlam head to Southampton to address his needs on a budget of £6,000

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team heads to south London to help a mum-of-two with her overflowing kitchen and ever-growing shoe collection. In just 24 hours, on a limited budget, the team adds clever storage to the kitchen and turns her spare room into a relaxing sanctuary with new shelving for her shoe display

programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Gethin Jones round off the working week with a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Creations of the Swansea Yarnbombers adorn postboxes across the Welsh city. This group of women, united by their passion for woolly creations, routinely sneak out under cover of darkness. Their work might appear on a park bench or decorate a tree, but this warm-hearted documentary follows them as they face their biggest challenge - decorating Mumbles pier

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: In the first half of a two-part special where the same teams do battle across two episodes, the guests are former Wales cross-code rugby star Scott Quinnell, ex-England goalkeeper Rachel Brown-Finnis, Great Britain sprinter Harry Aikines-Aryeetey and world champion swimmer Karen Pickering. With team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Lucy Beaumont and Desiree Burch, Strictly judge Anton Du Beke and actor Ralf Little join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: When Lee and Lucy are asked to cover for Anna on more than one occasion so she can go out at night for secret Italian lessons, they suspect the worst - that she is having an affair. Lee decides it is up to him to tell Toby that his marriage is in jeopardy and sets about finding the evidence. Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton, Abigail Cruttenden and Hugh Dennis

programme.title: Queen of Oz
programme.desc: When word gets out that Georgie has been sleeping with one of her staff, she fixes the problem by firing her 'boytoy' Augustus. Georgiana is excited to anticipate her face on the new Australian $5 notes, but when Zoe realises she approved the wrong - and unflattering - portrait, the staff goes into damage control. Hoping to alleviate her constant and ruthless coverage on Steele News, Georgie invites CEO Richard Steele to dinner with the plan to charm him. Matthew suggests she tell Steele she shares his love of hunting, but this plan quickly backfires. Comedy, starring Catherine Tate

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: The Sheffield band perform on the Pyramid stage, their third time headlining the festival and a decade on from their last appearance. Following a huge sold-out world tour and armed with their recent seventh studio album The Car, they are likely to be one of the talking points of this year's event. Songs likely to be performed include Brianstorm, Fluorescent Adolescent, R U Mine? and I Bet That You Look Good on the Dancefloor. Introduced by Jo Whiley and Clara Amfo

programme.title: The Miseducation of Cameron Post (2018)
programme.desc: After teenager Cameron is caught in the backseat of a car with the prom queen, she is sent away to a treatment centre in a remote area called God's Promise. While being subjected to questionable gay conversion therapies, she bonds with fellow residents as they pretend to go along with the process while waiting to be released. Drama, starring Chloe Grace Moretz and John Gallagher Jr

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team head to London to help Shirley clean her cluttered flat. In just 24 hours and with a limited budget, they design a bespoke kitchen unit, breathe new life into the living room and create clever storage in the bathroom

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Megan McCubbin heads to Corfe Castle, where a pair of peregrines have found the perfect nest site, high in the ruins, while Gillian Burke's road trip continues as she reaches the Menai Straits, exploring the wonderful wildlife that thrives there. There's also a discussion on the often unspoken subject of raptor persecution

programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Tennis: Queen's
programme.desc: The cinch Championships. Clare Balding presents coverage of day three of the men's grass-court tournament at Queen's Club, featuring the opening second-round singles matches. Eventual runner-up Filip Krajinovic came back from a set down to overcome experienced qualifier Sam Querrey at this stage last year, and two-time champion Marin Cilic prevailed in straight sets against Alexander Bublik. There was also a victory for Great Britain's Ryan Peniston against Francisco Cerundolo, but the other remaining home player, Jack Draper, lost out to Emil Ruusuvuori

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Rickie Haywood-Williams, Sally Phillips, Vikki Stone and Dan Walker test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels by tram to the former cotton town of Oldham on the edge of the Peak District. Here he visits Oldham Coliseum, the town's Victorian repertory theatre, and hears about the lifting of censorship by the Lord Chamberlain's Office in the late 1960s. He then goes hiking before a visit to Sheffield, where he attends a knife-making workshop. He ends this part of his journey admiring the striking post-war sculptures of Barbara Hepworth at the Yorkshire Sculpture Park near Wakefield

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace heads to Coventry to pay a visit the biggest tortilla factory in Europe, which makes 60,000 tonnes of snacks every year. Here, he follows the production of their UK bestseller, the 150g sharing bag of chilli heatwave flavour tortilla chips. Elsewhere, Cherry Healy visits the UK's largest chilli farm where her tastebuds take on the hottest chilli in the world

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers
programme.desc: Paul Murton sets off down the river Spey, Scotland's third longest river, encountering golden eagles, a Jacobite fugitive, lumberjacks, and salmon fishers along the way

programme.title: There She Goes
programme.desc: One-off return of the comedy drama about a family with a learning disabled daughter. Rosie is now 13 and is starting to display increasingly challenging, emotional and physical behaviour. She veers wildly from a joyous obsession with the letter X to sudden violent outbursts. But then the family realise Rosie is simply struggling to cope with the onset of puberty like any other teenage girl. Starring David Tennant, Jessica Hynes and Miley Locke

programme.title: Glastonbury Anthems
programme.desc: One final compilation of festival performances, featuring Dolly Parton delighting the crowd in the 2014 'legends slot', Coldplay in 2016 and the Cure taking to the stage in 2019

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Unspun World with John Simpson
programme.desc: The BBC's world affairs editor reflects on the week's major global news stories, talking to experts from around the world to go behind the headlines

programme.title: Hero: The Extraordinary Life of Mr Ulric Cross (2021)
programme.desc: Drama documentary telling the story of Trinidad-born Ulric Cross, who became the RAF's most decorated West Indian airman of the Second World War. He went on to become a presenter with the BBC, before acting as a go-between for several African countries in their struggles against imperialism during the 1950s and 1960s

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Julia Somerville and Angela Rippon investigate the case of a family whose once-loved home is now a wrecked shell, after an insurance claim made six years ago went disastrously wrong. Plus, the programme revisits a pledge made in 2018 by then-local government minister Rishi Sunak to keep private parking companies in check

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: A police officer's instinct leads to armed robbers being caught in the act and a dangerous driver turns out to be a big-time drug dealer

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The sewers take on new challenges in Reduce Reuse Recycle week, starting with making a pair of trousers with zero-waste before tackling a mountain of wasted tote bags in the Transformation Challenge. For a Made to Measure outfit, the sewers have been asked to source second-hand crochet blankets

programme.desc: The team help avid recycler Lynne and make use of her materials. Using her old scaffold boards, the team make new shelving for her and build a giant bunk for her son's bedroom

programme.desc: Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan appreciate spring's simple wildlife pleasures at RSPB Arne in Dorset and reveal footage documenting the lifecycle of a jellyfish

programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Tennis: Queen's
programme.desc: The cinch Championships. Clare Balding presents coverage of day four of the men's grass-court tournament at Queen's Club, featuring the concluding second-round singles matches. Tommy Paul claimed a dominant victory over three-time Grand Slam-winner Stan Warwinka at this stage last year to set up a meeting with defending champion Matteo Berrettini, who edged past Denis Kudla. There were also victories for Alejandro Davidovich Fokina and Botic van de Zandschulp against Alex de Minaur and Grigor Dimitrov respectively

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Rickie Haywood-Williams, Sally Phillips, Vikki Stone and Dan Walker keep their eyes on the prize ahead of Friday's final

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In Wakefield, West Yorkshire, Michael Portillo visits the National Coal Mining Museum for England at Caphouse Colliery. In Leeds, he heads for the Chapeltown area to investigate the origins of the Leeds West Indian carnival in 1967 and tries his hand on the steel drums

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from the opening day of the one-off Women's Ashes Test, held at Trent Bridge in Nottingham. Unlike the men's version, the Women's Ashes consists of this match, three one-dayers and three Twenty20s, with four points awarded to the winners of the Test, or two apiece if it is a draw, and two points for each limited-overs match

programme.title: Windrush: Portraits of a Generation
programme.desc: Marking the 75th anniversary of the arrival of the HMT Empire Windrush to British shores in 1948, cameras follow a project spearheaded by King Charles. He commissioned 10 leading artists, from Britain and abroad, to create portraits of 10 pioneering members of the Windrush Generation. The sitters, many in their nineties, speak frankly about their experiences of arriving in Britain, making lives for themselves, and the contribution they have made to their communities and the nation

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost shares the results of his wild meadow turf experiment. In North Yorkshire, Nick Bailey discovers the range of floral beauty of Cornus Kousa, the dog wood tree. And Toby Buckland visits a back garden near Milton Keynes with seven ponds

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne and Jack Saunders look ahead to a packed weekend of live music. They bring stories from the first couple of days of the site being open, including the summer solstice, and also look at what's to come, including headline performances from the Arctic Monkeys, Guns N' Roses, Elton John and Lizzo. They are also joined by special guests and present preview performances

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: The Unwanted: The Secret Windrush Files
programme.desc: David Olusoga opens previously unseen government files to argue that the Windrush scandal and the so-called hostile environment for black British immigrants has been 70 years in the making. The film features Sarah O'Connor, Anthony Bryan and Judy Griffith. Settled in the UK legally since childhood, they were re-classified as illegal immigrants by new regulations. Unable to show proof of their nationality status, they lost jobs, savings and their health, facing deportation back to countries they could barely remember

programme.title: Africa Rising with Afua Hirsch
programme.desc: The energy and ambition of young creatives in Nigeria, asking what drives their success in everything from music to film-making. Afua meets Ayobami Adebayo, award-winning author and rising star of the Lagos literary scene. She also discovers how designer Adeju Thompson is blazing a trail with his non-binary clothes label Lagos Space Programme, cooks giant snails with Nigerian chef Obehi Ekhomu-El Herfi and talks African music with singer Mádé Kuti - the grandson of Afrobeat legend Fela Kuti

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc: The story of the woman who can smell Parkinson's disease. Plus, the world of prescription fraud and an investigation into the science of hydration

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: Disguised underwater cameras capture footage of sea creatures. The first episode features the most intelligent animals in the ocean, including sperm whales and octopuses, which are shown using improvised tools to fend off rivals. The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: A team of cleaners and DIY experts visit Safiyah in London, who is suffering from a condition that impedes her ability to bend. In just 24 hours with a limited budget, they come up with clever fixes and cleaning hacks for those hard-to-reach areas to help her regain her independence

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins this leg of his journey at Liverpool's historic waterfront, where he visits the International Slavery Museum at Royal Albert Dock, before heading underground to discover one of the most important and secret rooms of the Second World War, the Royal Navy's Western Approaches Headquarters. His next stop is Crosby on the Merseyside coastline in Sefton, before making his way north to Blackpool, the last stop on this leg of his journey

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph patrols Altrincham recycling centre in Greater Manchester, hoping to find three items packed with potential and give them the chance to shine once more. She finds a pair of folding chairs, an old washstand and a collection of glass bottles. Upholsterer Simion Hawtin-Smith and upcycler Sarah Parmenter set to work helping Jacqui transform her finds

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team arrives in Kent to help a busy family of four whose members have recently converted their garage into a wet room, but now lack storiage room. In just 24 hours and on a limited budget, they convert the original downstairs toilet into a store cupboard and build clever seat storage in the family room

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost visits a walled garden in Somerset to meet volunteers who are gardening alongside those who need help to transform their lives. At Longmeadow, Monty Don creates two different planting schemes for pots for shady spaces, transplants grasses in the jewel garden and plants out his favourite varieties of tomatoes. And Rachel de Thame revels in the seasonal displays of Azaleas in Shropshire

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Politics UK
programme.desc: The week's political proceedings around the UK

programme.title: Tennis: Queen's
programme.desc: The cinch Championships. Clare Balding presents coverage of day five of the men's grass-court tournament at Queen's Club, featuring the singles quarter-finals. Filip Krajinovi ended any hopes of a British winner last year when he came back from a set down to overcome Ryan Peniston. His second-round opponent was confirmed as two-time champion Marin Cilic, who won in straight sets against Emil Ruusuvuori. In the other half of the draw, there were victories for Botic van de Zandschulp and reigning champion Matteo Berrettini against Alejandro Davidovich Fokina and Tommy Paul respectively

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Rickie Haywood-Williams, Sally Phillips, Vikki Stone and Dan Walker make a final bid for victory before Richard Osman announces the week's winner

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his post-war exploration of northwest England in Bradford, Shipley and Hebden Bridge. In Bradford's Centenary Square, he encounters local literary giant, JB Priestley. At Shipley station, Michael discovers a nature reserve in the middle of the car park. Finally the Calder Valley Line delivers the presenter to the photogenic station at Hebden Bridge

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Wildflowers and houseplants are at the heart of this week's show. Carole Baxter visits the garden of a specialist in the sowing and cultivation of wildflowers. Kirsty Wilson upcycles a second-hand cabinet and turns it into a display case for houseplants, complete with specialist lighting

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne and Clara Amfo are live at Glastonbury Festival as the first full day of music gets going. They introduce performances by Glasgow band Texas, who return to the Pyramid Stage for the first time since 1999, and Los Angeles trio Gabriels, who take to the West Holts Stage. Plus, special guests, and there is an intimate performance in the park studio

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Clara Amfo and Jo Whiley gear up to welcome the first headliner of the weekend in the form Arctic Monkeys, while Jack Saunders reports from the Pyramid Stage pit, soaking up all the excitement ahead of their highly anticipated third headline performance at the festival. Clara and Jo introduce music from the likes of Brighton duo Royal Blood on the Pyramid Stage, as well as Los Angeles indie rockers Warpaint, enigmatic duo Sparks, and Scottish trio Young Fathers

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts an extended edition of the quiz, with Ed Byrne, Cally Beaton, Jack Dee and Alan Davies answering theatre-themed questions

programme.title: Live at the Apollo Bites
programme.desc: Highlights from the stand-up comedy showcase, featuring performances from Tom Allen, Jess Fostekew and Mawaan Rizwan

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Jo Whiley and Jack Saunders look back at highlights from the other headline acts of the evening, including US superstar Kelis. Swedish experimental synth-pop purveyor Fever Ray, and Hot Chip on the newly named Woodsies Stage. There's also a chance to see some of the special moments from the first 24 hours

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Around one in seven in the UK now takes an antidepressant. Globally they have made the pharmaceutical industry billions. When the current generation of drugs was launched 35 years ago, they promised a safe and effective treatment, free from the side effects of older medicines. But have they lived up to those claims? Whilst many people say they have benefited from taking them, Panorama reveals evidence of some companies trying to conceal concerns about their drugs and follows patients who've suffered serious side effects as they continue their fight to be heard

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Northern Ireland
programme.desc: A look at how the conflict became an intelligence war, as the police and the army made efforts to infiltrate paramilitary organisations and recruit informers. Anne Marie reveals how a loyalist gun attack at a funeral in Milltown Cemetery in West Belfast in 1988 prompted her to plant firebombs in city centre shops, primed to explode at night. She then became caught up in an intelligence web of informers and interrogation.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Yorkshire Wolds Way with Paul Rose
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which adventurer Paul Rose explores the 79 miles of the Yorkshire Wolds Way, one of Britain's least well-known national walking trails. The trail starts at the Humber Estuary and ends at the North Yorkshire seaside resort of Filey. On the way, Paul takes in the views from the top of the Humber Bridge, learns to ride a penny farthing and searches out the spots made internationally famous by the artist David Hockney

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Made in Britain
programme.desc: The former steeplejack fulfils a personal ambition by driving his traction engine across the Scammonden Bridge near Huddersfield, West Yorkshire. He also visits a forge in Sheffield and watches crucible steel being made by the experts at Abbeydale Industrial Hamlet

programme.title: Thailand: Earth's Tropical Paradise
programme.desc: The mountains and forests of northern Thailand, an area that is home to a variety of wildlife, leading to unusual partnerships developing between animals and people. Narrated by Sophie Okonedo

programme.title: Lenny Henry's Caribbean Britain
programme.desc: Part two of two. Lenny looks back on his coming of age and explores how he and other second and third generation, British-born Caribbean children began to mesh their identity into their art. From the theatre and arts collectives of the 1980s, to the making of brands, to the evolution of jungle and grime music, he explores how the output of successive generations has moved into the mainstream, enriching and transforming Britain's cultural offering

programme.title: Stephen Poliakoff Remembers - She's Been Away
programme.desc: The writer looks back at his 1989 drama, which was directed by Peter Hall and featured the final appearance of Peggy Ashcroft

programme.title: She's Been Away
programme.desc: An elderly woman recently discharged from a mental hospital after 60 years is reluctantly taken in by relatives and forges an unlikely bond with her nephew's pregnant wife - little realising the ill effects it will have on the family. Drama, starring Peggy Ashcroft, Geraldine James, Rachel Kempson and James Fox

programme.title: South Africa in Pictures
programme.desc: British photographer Rankin, whose subjects have included Britney Spears, Kylie Minogue, Damien Hirst and the Queen, turns his focus on South Africa. He explores the country's rich history on film, and discovers the role the art has played in recording the story of its people. Includes contributions by war reporters the Bang Bang Club and photographers David Goldblatt and Alf Kumalo

programme.title: Yorkshire Wolds Way with Paul Rose
programme.desc: Part two of two. Adventurer Paul Rose concludes his exploration of the 79-mile Yorkshire Wolds Way, taking to the skies to get a unique view of its stretch of chalk downland. He also receives a special invitation to a military base that has been keeping the nation safe since the start of the Second World War

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Made in Britain
programme.desc: The former steeplejack investigates traditional craftsmanship in Yorkshire and Derbyshire, including glass-cutting, making rivets using the traditional hot forge method, and ornate carving. He also catches up with some old friends in the process of restoring a showman's engine and watches workers at the Midland Railway Centre as they repair damaged trains

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven (1960)
programme.desc: Oppressed Mexican villagers cross the border into America looking to buy guns to defend their homes and crops from bandits. Instead they encounter an enigmatic loner who persuades them to hire a band of gunslingers to teach the villagers how to fight before the marauders return. Western, with Yul Brynner, Steve McQueen, Charles Bronson, Robert Vaughn, James Coburn and Eli Wallach

programme.title: The French Connection (1971)
programme.desc: Two tough New York cops use unorthodox methods to try to break an international drug ring. When their information leads them to place a candy store under surveillance, they discover the owners are the American agents for a French kingpin planning to ship millions of dollars worth of heroin into the US. Oscar-winning fact-based thriller, starring Gene Hackman, Roy Scheider, Fernando Rey and Tony Lo Bianco

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: A look back at TV appearances by stars of the silver screen from the 1970s, using archive footage to tell the stories of their lives and careers

programme.title: Black Firsts
programme.desc: A profile of Olympic sprinter Emmanuel McDonald Bailey, who set a British 100m mark that stood for over a quarter of a century

programme.title: Black Firsts
programme.desc: A profile of Karlene Davis, the first black woman to head the Royal College of Midwives

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: The scientists scouring the universe for signs of extraterrestrial life, including the film researchers at the Green Bank Telescope searching for radio signals from 'Tabby's Star', a star so mysterious some scientists believe it might be surrounded by a Dyson Sphere - a vast energy collector built by advanced aliens. The film also features the 2006 discovery by husband and wife team Duncan Lorimer and Maura McLaughlin of an enigmatic signal from space, known as a fast radio burst, and its subsequent explanations

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from the second day of the one-off Women's Ashes Test, held at Trent Bridge in Nottingham. Australia have held the urn since 2015, winning three and drawing one of the last four series, but England will be hopeful of a competitive display in front of their own fans

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: The gardener explores Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, where particular olive trees planted by them are still grown today. Here Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections, as well as meeting up with the widow of English writer Gerald Durrell. She takes Monty up into the mountains on a wildflower trail

programme.title: Greece with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Part one of a two-part series in which the presenter takes a tour of the country, travelling from the islands of the Aegean to Athens. Along the way he meets local people including gun-toting priests and the last sponge-divers in the world, and discovers how they are coping with their country's current crises

programme.title: The Royle Family
programme.desc: Nana is staying with the family while she recuperates from her recent cataract operation and Barbara is anxious that Jim will hit the roof if she stays much longer. Antony is having love troubles, most of which are thanks to constant teasing from his family. When he finally storms off, the rest of the family are left blaming one another for who upset him most, all except Nana, who is fast asleep

programme.title: Classic Albums
programme.desc: Carly Simon talks about her 1972 album No Secrets, reflecting on her time with ex-husband James Taylor, a heroin addict when they first met. She also recounts her number of highly public affairs in the early 1970s and how her experience fed into the record's most famous song, You're So Vain, performing the missing fourth verse on the piano - the first time she has ever sung it along with the melody

programme.title: Duran Duran: A Night In
programme.desc: Simon Le Bon, Nick Rhodes, John Taylor and Roger Taylor sit back to watch and talk through personally selected clips of archive television, music shows, movies, performances, adverts and children's shows that have inspired them across their career. The band discuss their influences from the worlds of film and art, referencing Blade Runner, Andy Warhol and Tomorrow's World, and ranging from Barbarella to Virginia Plain and Midnight Express

programme.title: Bruce Dickinson: Scream for Me Sarajevo (2017)
programme.desc: Documentary about a 1994 concert by Bruce Dickinson and his band Skunkworks in Sarajevo, when the capital of Bosnia and Herzegovina was in its third year under siege during the ongoing Bosnian War. Featuring personal accounts of the band members who risked their lives to perform in a war zone, and the fans who attended the concert while living in the midst of continual violence

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Plastic is one of the greatest inventions in human history. It makes so much of our lives possible, but how we dispose of it is now a massive problem. By the year 2050 it's thought that there will be more plastic than fish in our seas. So what can we do about it? First, ditch the disposable plastic water bottle and go for tap water in a reusable bottle. Better for the environment and cheaper too! Next, join a beach clean. It may seem like this problem is too big for us to handle but many hands make light work. Reduce, reuse and, importantly, recycle. And even more importantly than that, don't drop litter. A bag that is thrown on the streets of London could end up on the coast of Africa or in the belly of a whale or a turtle. Lastly and most importantly, know that every single person can make a difference. One single plastic bag could choke a turtle or sunfish. One plastic straw could be the end of a gorgeous, iconic animal, so know you have power and use it.

programme.desc: Delivery Duckling arrives and tells Love Monster he has been chosen to be sipping host at a special Hot Chocolate Day ceremony. She then cycles off before telling him what a sipping host does. Love Monster goes to Elder Panda to ask his advice, and he tells him there are many ways to serve hot chocolate - each person needs to find their own unique way. Elder Panda adds honey and banana from his garden to his. Love Monster starts the ceremony by adding his signature marshmallows, but then Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny announces she puts marshmallows in hers too. Love Monster thinks he needs to use something more unusual, so he adds pickles, but this doesn't go down well - in fact, it tastes horrible! It turns out the reason why he was chosen was so that he could make hot chocolate the way he always makes it. He does, and everyone loves it.

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Love Monster has been chosen as the prize-picker at the Harvest Day contest, but when he gets there it turns out there is only one prize and three teams. This means he has to choose a winner between his friends - Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny, Bad Idea Puppy and the In-Chicks. Round one is fancy fashion foodies, and everyone loves Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny, so Love Monster thinks he can just pick her. Then it is round two - the veggie variety show. Everyone loves the In-Chicks, so Love Monster now has to choose between them and Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny. Then it is the final round, which is the tantalizing taste test of home grown goodies, and this time everyone loves Bad Idea Puppy. programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Sebastiaan's making a South African bobotie, which is a local dish his family have shared with him. He starts by putting chopped spring onions, grated courgette, turmeric powder, ground coriander and torn red pepper into a casserole dish and cooking them. He then adds garlic puree, ginger puree, chutney and chopped tomatoes to cooked beef mince. Sebastiaan then carefully makes powder out of his special ingredient, cumin seeds, and adds the powder to the beef mixture. Sebastiaan mixes both the vegetables and the beef in an oven dish and flattens them before adding two bay leaves. He adds a topping of milk and egg and then places it in the oven. Sebastiaan has a wonderfully decorated table, and he has another traditional treat to go with his bobotie. Will his friends figure out what his special ingredient is?

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Elder Panda is teaching Love Monster to fly a kite. Love Monster loves to watch it swish around in the air. Elder Panda goes off to get some froyo, which is perfect on Kite Day. Before he goes, he tells Love Monster that soon it will be time for him to go on to his next kiting challenge. Love Monster looks at all the other kites and sees the dragon kite, which is the largest kite of them all. Love Monster’s small kite doesn’t seem that exciting any more. He decides to try the dragon kite for just a minute. At first it seems easy, but then a wind gets it tangled in a tree. The rope breaks, and the kite flies off, causing mayhem in Fluffytown with everyone thinking it is a real dragon invasion. Finally, Elder Panda arrives and manages to bring it down to the ground using an umbrella, and Love Monster comes clean, saying how sorry he is. Elder Panda is disappointed but he does understand, as he too wanted to fly before he could run, but sometimes you have to start small before going big.

There's lots to see at the exhibition - one photo in particular catches Gran Gran's eye. programme.desc: Elder Panda is teaching Love Monster to fly a kite. Love Monster loves to watch it swish around in the air. Elder Panda goes off to get some froyo, which is perfect on Kite Day. Before he goes, he tells Love Monster that soon it will be time for him to go on to his next kiting challenge. Love Monster looks at all the other kites and sees the dragon kite, which is the largest kite of them all. Love Monster’s small kite doesn’t seem that exciting any more. He decides to try the dragon kite for just a minute. At first it seems easy, but then a wind gets it tangled in a tree. The rope breaks, and the kite flies off, causing mayhem in Fluffytown with everyone thinking it is a real dragon invasion. Finally, Elder Panda arrives and manages to bring it down to the ground using an umbrella, and Love Monster comes clean, saying how sorry he is. Elder Panda is disappointed but he does understand, as he too wanted to fly before he could run, but sometimes you have to start small before going big.

Bear eventually traces the family line back several centuries revealing, to his delight, Scottish ancestry. programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: Mark Wright, his brother Josh and father Mark Sr head to Northumberland. Mark Sr regales his sons with facts about Hadrian's Wall, local castles and the origins of Earl Grey tea. The history buff is in charge of choosing the night's accommodation and picks rooms in 800-year-old Chillingham castle - which Mark Jr is horrified to discover is reputed to be the most haunted castle in Britain. The next morning the trio partake in a little coasteering, which involves climbing up and down the rocky shoreline and jumping off cliffs into the North Sea. The visit ends with a relaxing trip to a spa

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Elaine and Paul in Mickleover, Derbyshire, love all things 1950s - be they cars, clothes or music. Elaine also loves fairies. programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Kevin Clifton, aka 'Kevin from Grimsby', is proud of his northern roots, but wants to investigate a long-standing family rumour from much further afield. According to his father, the Cliftons might be related to a mysterious woman called Matooski from the First Nations of Canada. This takes the dancer on an extraordinary journey to the country's remote 18th-century trading posts. The trek reveals that he comes from a long line of skilled and courageous female ancestors who survived - and thrived - against the odds

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts is in the Cornish village of Blackwater to see a three-bed detached bungalow with an exterior that reminds him of a Battenberg cake. Tommy Walsh is in Wandsworth, south London to visit a large period property split into three separate flats and an eyewatering guide price of over £1million. Martel Maxwell takes a trip to Bilston in the West Midlands, where a three-bed semi with a rather large driveway catches her eye

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley presents the contest from Hemswell in Lincolnshire. Experts Izzie Balmer and Mark Stacey help guide the Red and Blue teams to a prime purchase in a bid to make the greater profit at auction. Caroline also pays a visit to the Lincoln Castle Victorian Prison

programme.desc: Jay Blades is at Altrincham Recycling Centre on a mission to rescue and revive unwanted items. programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Angus wants a garden that reminds him of his favourite holiday destination, Cyprus. Currently he hates his awkward shaped plot and absolutely loathes the domineering dark grey retaining wall, which he thinks makes the space look like a prison yard. Angus loves to barbeque and entertain friends so would like a generous Cypriot-inspired space in which to do that and is also keen to try to grow his own produce. Lee Burkhill and Flo Headlam head to Southampton to address his needs on a budget of £6,000

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team heads to south London to help a mum-of-two with her overflowing kitchen and ever-growing shoe collection. programme.title: Pointless

programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Gethin Jones round off the working week with a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Creations of the Swansea Yarnbombers adorn postboxes across the Welsh city. This group of women, united by their passion for woolly creations, routinely sneak out under cover of darkness. Their work might appear on a park bench or decorate a tree, but this warm-hearted documentary follows them as they face their biggest challenge - decorating Mumbles pier

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: In the first half of a two-part special where the same teams do battle across two episodes, the guests are former Wales cross-code rugby star Scott Quinnell, ex-England goalkeeper Rachel Brown-Finnis, Great Britain sprinter Harry Aikines-Aryeetey and world champion swimmer Karen Pickering. With team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness

programme.title: Wynne's Welsh 70s
programme.desc: Alongside his dog Ginny, the celebrated tenor and broadcaster mines BBC Wales's archives of 1977 to present some of that year's TV gold. Highlights include actor Richard Burton visiting his home town and singer Dorothy Squires organising her own tour. Welsh cooking also comes under the spotlight, the One Man and His Dog finals are relived, while there's a singles club in Swansea that is born from the loneliness of divorce

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: When Lee and Lucy are asked to cover for Anna on more than one occasion so she can go out at night for secret Italian lessons, they suspect the worst - that she is having an affair. Lee decides it is up to him to tell Toby that his marriage is in jeopardy and sets about finding the evidence. Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton, Abigail Cruttenden and Hugh Dennis

programme.title: Queen of Oz
programme.desc: When word gets out that Georgie has been sleeping with one of her staff, she fixes the problem by firing her 'boytoy' Augustus. Georgiana is excited to anticipate her face on the new Australian $5 notes, but when Zoe realises she approved the wrong - and unflattering - portrait, the staff goes into damage control. Hoping to alleviate her constant and ruthless coverage on Steele News, Georgie invites CEO Richard Steele to dinner with the plan to charm him. Matthew suggests she tell Steele she shares his love of hunting, but this plan quickly backfires. Comedy, starring Catherine Tate

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: The Sheffield band perform on the Pyramid stage, their third time headlining the festival and a decade on from their last appearance. Following a huge sold-out world tour and armed with their recent seventh studio album The Car, they are likely to be one of the talking points of this year's event. Songs likely to be performed include Brianstorm, Fluorescent Adolescent, R U Mine? and I Bet That You Look Good on the Dancefloor. Introduced by Jo Whiley and Clara Amfo

programme.title: The Miseducation of Cameron Post (2018)
programme.desc: After teenager Cameron is caught in the backseat of a car with the prom queen, she is sent away to a treatment centre in a remote area called God's Promise. While being subjected to questionable gay conversion therapies, she bonds with fellow residents as they pretend to go along with the process while waiting to be released. Drama, starring Chloe Grace Moretz and John Gallagher Jr

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil ropes Ritchie in to dig up dirt on George's missing wife and Suki convinces Nish they need to sack Eve. Keanu realises Finlay's car was deliberately damaged and Ben backtracks on having Lexi live with him

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team mark National Windrush Day by restoring items that celebrate the Windrush generation. Beverley comes into the barn with a British passport issued to her father in Jamaica in 1948 which served as his legally binding document to come to the UK to help rebuild after the Second World War. Keithly brings in a suitcase used by his mother that holds memories of her journey from the island of Nevis to the UK in 1956. Brother and sister duo Dorcas and Stephan bring a precious clock for the attention of horologist Steven Fletcher, it being the first item their parents Hermann and Keturah saved up to buy after arriving in the UK from Antigua. Patrick Vernon OBE brings with him his British-Jamaican Second World War veteran father's radiogram for repair

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: In Art Week, the sewers start by make a skirt inspired by the Modernist movement. In the transformation challenge, the contestants are given canvases painted by local art students and turn them into dresses, making use of the sculptural fabric and painted design. For the Made to Measure challenge, the sewers take inspiration from the 20th Century Surrealist movement to create fantastical outfits for a mind-bending catwalk

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Staged
programme.desc: The gang try to pinpoint where it all started and what went wrong. Georgia spies an opportunity as both David and Michael worry the other prefers working alone

programme.title: Staged
programme.desc: David and Michael try to break the standstill on the project while Simon tries becoming a dentist after giving up writing. Georgia's efforts turn manipulative

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Adventurer Bear Grylls traces his ancestry, starting by exploring his paternal army-serving grandfather Ted Grylls' old trunk, intriguingly full of documents marked 'Top Secret'. Next, Bear wants finds out more about the life of his beloved grandad Neville. His father - Bear's great grandfather - is revealed to be a loving family man and progressive headmaster who modernised Harrow School. Bear eventually traces the family line back several centuries revealing, to his delight, Scottish ancestry. A trip to north of the border uncovers the story of Bear's 10-X great grandfather, the Duke of Argyll

programme.title: The Edit
programme.desc: David Farrell presents a rundown of the week's entertainment highlights, including Robert Carlyle and the Full Monty cast reuniting on the small screen after a quarter of a century apart, the stars of Outlander returning for the show's penultimate season, and Gary Barlow bringing the Take That musical Greatest Days to UK cinemas

programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A chef who makes a bogus claim by exaggerating his injuries finds himself in hot water, and a dodgy driver who stops his car in the middle of a roundabout is caught out on CCTV

programme.title: Dirty Rotten Scammers
programme.desc: A man who lost £14,000 from his accounts after clicking on a link he believed to be from an online auction site. Presented by Michelle and Mavis Ackerley

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents from Hele, near Exeter, and discovers the link between Strictly, the Mars Landing and a 19th-century inventor. With Caroline Hawley and John Cameron

programme.title: Scottish First Minister's Questions
programme.desc: Kirsten Campbell introduces live coverage of questions to First Minister Humza Yousaf in the Scottish Parliament at Holyrood

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Zara has some explaining to do. Emma and Al end up on the wrong side of Rosie. On her first shift with Rob, Claudia gets caught up in a family feud

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph patrols Altrincham recycling centre in Greater Manchester, hoping to find three items packed with potential and give them the chance to shine once more. She finds a pair of folding chairs, an old washstand and a collection of glass bottles. Upholsterer Simion Hawtin-Smith and upcycler Sarah Parmenter set to work helping Jacqui transform her finds

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonli Shah helps a Nottinghamshire couple find a new home in Argyll and Bute. The host also tries out paddleboarding and seaplaning

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Originally from India, Bindu grew up with a garden full of vegetables, nature and birdsong and would like to recreate a bit of that in her modest garden in Warrington, Cheshire. The garden is a sun trap, so she and partner Vivek want some height and shade in the plot as well as raised beds for fruit and veg growing. It's very important to them that they try and care for the environment too so would like the means to harvest rainwater and compost waste. With a relatively small budget of £3,000, Charlie Dimmock and Lee Hull create a garden that is both eco-friendly and looks beautiful
