Beverley comes into the barn with a British passport issued to her father in Jamaica in 1948 which served as his legally binding document to come to the UK to help rebuild after the Second World War. Keithly brings in a suitcase used by his mother that holds memories of her journey from the island of Nevis to the UK in 1956. Brother and sister duo Dorcas and Stephan bring a precious clock for the attention of horologist Steven Fletcher, it being the first item their parents Hermann and Keturah saved up to buy after arriving in the UK from Antigua. Patrick Vernon OBE brings with him his British-Jamaican Second World War veteran father's radiogram for repair

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: In Art Week, the sewers start by make a skirt inspired by the Modernist movement. In the transformation challenge, the contestants are given canvases painted by local art students and turn them into dresses, making use of the sculptural fabric and painted design. For the Made to Measure challenge, the sewers take inspiration from the 20th Century Surrealist movement to create fantastical outfits for a mind-bending catwalk

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The King's Hall of Fame
programme.desc: Comedian Jake O'Kane goes on a nostalgic trip back through the archives as he tells the story of the Belfast venue, which is currently being redeveloped into a wellbeing park. He reveals its place in the city's life since 1934, from the annual agricultural show to pop concerts, Ideal Home exhibitions to protest marches, and election counts to boxing

programme.title: Staged
programme.desc: The gang try to pinpoint where it all started and what went wrong. Georgia spies an opportunity as both David and Michael worry the other prefers working alone

programme.title: Staged
programme.desc: David and Michael try to break the standstill on the project while Simon tries becoming a dentist after giving up writing. Georgia's efforts turn manipulative

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Adventurer Bear Grylls traces his ancestry, starting by exploring his paternal army-serving grandfather Ted Grylls' old trunk, intriguingly full of documents marked 'Top Secret'. Next, Bear wants finds out more about the life of his beloved grandad Neville. His father - Bear's great grandfather - is revealed to be a loving family man and progressive headmaster who modernised Harrow School. Bear eventually traces the family line back several centuries revealing, to his delight, Scottish ancestry. A trip to north of the border uncovers the story of Bear's 10-X great grandfather, the Duke of Argyll

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A chef who makes a bogus claim by exaggerating his injuries finds himself in hot water, and a dodgy driver who stops his car in the middle of a roundabout is caught out on CCTV

programme.title: Dirty Rotten Scammers
programme.desc: A man who lost £14,000 from his accounts after clicking on a link he believed to be from an online auction site. Presented by Michelle and Mavis Ackerley

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin, Martel Maxwell and Tommy Walsh follow an impressive project to create four brand new houses in Alcester in Warwickshire. They also report on efforts to transform terraced houses in Little Hulton in Greater Manchester and Norwich

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents from Hele, near Exeter, and discovers the link between Strictly, the Mars Landing and a 19th-century inventor. With Caroline Hawley and John Cameron

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Zara has some explaining to do. Emma and Al end up on the wrong side of Rosie. On her first shift with Rob, Claudia gets caught up in a family feud

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph patrols Altrincham recycling centre in Greater Manchester, hoping to find three items packed with potential and give them the chance to shine once more. She finds a pair of folding chairs, an old washstand and a collection of glass bottles. Upholsterer Simion Hawtin-Smith and upcycler Sarah Parmenter set to work helping Jacqui transform her finds

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonli Shah helps a Nottinghamshire couple find a new home in Argyll and Bute. The host also tries out paddleboarding and seaplaning

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Originally from India, Bindu grew up with a garden full of vegetables, nature and birdsong and would like to recreate a bit of that in her modest garden in Warrington, Cheshire. The garden is a sun trap, so she and partner Vivek want some height and shade in the plot as well as raised beds for fruit and veg growing. It's very important to them that they try and care for the environment too so would like the means to harvest rainwater and compost waste. With a relatively small budget of £3,000, Charlie Dimmock and Lee Hull create a garden that is both eco-friendly and looks beautiful

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team arrives in Kent to help a busy family of four whose members have recently converted their garage into a wet room, but now lack storage room. In just 24 hours and on a limited budget, they convert the original downstairs toilet into a store cupboard and build clever seat storage in the family room

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Lauren Laverne reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Gethin Jones present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The truth about what happened to Rose Knight is finally revealed

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Elaine and Paul in Mickleover, Derbyshire, love all things 1950s - be they cars, clothes or music. Elaine also loves fairies. On a budget of £3,000, Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull create a garden inspired by the rock and roll era that will also make the couple's fairy-tale dreams come true

programme.title: Community Life
programme.desc: Barra Best presents from Dungannon, a town whose population has been bolstered by the arrival of people from East Timor in recent years. He also meets some older people learning new tricks at circus school. Jennie Browne learns how the newest residents are influencing life in the Co Tyrone town, but also how important their collective cultural identity remains. Cate Conway is in her pet heaven when she attends a competition for the furriest of furry cats, while Vinny Hurrell learns of support for people struggling with depression and poor mental health

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Kevin Clifton, aka 'Kevin from Grimsby', is proud of his northern roots, but wants to investigate a long-standing family rumour from much further afield. According to his father, the Cliftons might be related to a mysterious woman called Matooski from the First Nations of Canada. This takes the dancer on an extraordinary journey to the country's remote 18th-century trading posts. The trek reveals that he comes from a long line of skilled and courageous female ancestors who survived - and thrived - against the odds

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The View
programme.desc: Mark Carruthers presents a review of the week's political news, including reports on the latest events at Stormont and Westminster. Plus, comment and analysis with studio guests

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Clacton-on-Sea, Essex, to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: A rota of BBC journalists, such as Adam Fleming and Chris Mason, contribute to the weekly round-up from Westminster. Collectively, they deliver their usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip concerning the biggest stories in politics

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: Naga Munchetty revisits more shocking stories from the archive, including the men who made millions by deliberately causing car accidents, endangering innocent lives. Plus, how the so-called victim who claimed an accident had left him terrified of heights blew his claim out of the water when he posted pictures of himself at the top of Europe's highest water slide

programme.title: Dirty Rotten Scammers
programme.desc: A woman who clicked a link she thought was from her phone company, which led to her losing out on big money. Presented by Mavis and Michelle Ackerley

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts is in the Cornish village of Blackwater to see a three-bed detached bungalow with an exterior that reminds him of a Battenberg cake. Tommy Walsh is in Wandsworth, south London to visit a large period property split into three separate flats and an eyewatering guide price of over £1million. Martel Maxwell takes a trip to Bilston in the West Midlands, where a three-bed semi with a rather large driveway catches her eye

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley presents the contest from Hemswell in Lincolnshire. Experts Izzie Balmer and Mark Stacey help guide the Red and Blue teams to a prime purchase in a bid to make the greater profit at auction. Caroline also pays a visit to the Lincoln Castle Victorian Prison

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: When a troubled soul from the past returns, the priest must investigate the new chapter of the Church of Apollo. Crime drama based on the GK Chesterton stories, with Mark Williams

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades is at Altrincham Recycling Centre on a mission to rescue and revive unwanted items. With two eclectic skip-finds to transform, he turns to designer Sarah Peterson to update a side table and chest of drawers. Jay takes on four dining chairs as his own creative project. Narrated by Arthur Smith

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Denise Nurse visits the coastal county of Cornwall, helping a couple to turn their favourite holiday destination into their permanent home on a budget of £475,000. Away from the search, she visits a new development that's tackling the county's housing crisis by prioritising the needs of local Cornish people

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Angus wants a garden that reminds him of his favourite holiday destination, Cyprus. Currently he hates his awkward shaped plot and absolutely loathes the domineering dark grey retaining wall, which he thinks makes the space look like a prison yard. Angus loves to barbeque and entertain friends so would like a generous Cypriot-inspired space in which to do that and is also keen to try to grow his own produce. Lee Burkhill and Flo Headlam head to Southampton to address his needs on a budget of £6,000

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team heads to south London to help a mum-of-two with her overflowing kitchen and ever-growing shoe collection. In just 24 hours, on a limited budget, the team adds clever storage to the kitchen and turns her spare room into a relaxing sanctuary with new shelving for her shoe display

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Lauren Laverne reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Gethin Jones round off the working week with a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: Feed Yourself Fitter with Stephen Nolan
programme.desc: Stephen visits student nurse Jennifer in East Belfast. Studying hard for her finals while working long hours in Craigavon Intensive Care Unit, she has little time to look after herself. Mindlessly eating junk to keep her energy levels up, Jennifer is feeling guilty and hypocritical that as a nurse she is giving out advice to patients about their health and diet that she obviously does not follow herself. Her father's dying wish was for his daughter to be the best nurse she could be, so she turns to chef Paula McIntyre hoping her tips will help her cut out binge snacking, which she thinks is holding her back from excelling at her chosen profession

programme.title: Restoration Rescue
programme.desc: Patrick Bradley transforms a derelict cottage and barn on his family farm in Maghera. With no one having lived there for over 100 years and only being used as storage and shelter for animals since, he plans to make the buildings family spaces again. With so much family history tied up in the fabric of the buildings, Patrick feels the pressure to get the restoration right for the generations before him and those to come

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: Mark Wright, his brother Josh and father Mark Sr head to Northumberland. Mark Sr regales his sons with facts about Hadrian's Wall, local castles and the origins of Earl Grey tea. The history buff is in charge of choosing the night's accommodation and picks rooms in 800-year-old Chillingham castle - which Mark Jr is horrified to discover is reputed to be the most haunted castle in Britain. The next morning the trio partake in a little coasteering, which involves climbing up and down the rocky shoreline and jumping off cliffs into the North Sea. The visit ends with a relaxing trip to a spa

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: When Lee and Lucy are asked to cover for Anna on more than one occasion so she can go out at night for secret Italian lessons, they suspect the worst - that she is having an affair. Lee decides it is up to him to tell Toby that his marriage is in jeopardy and sets about finding the evidence. Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton, Abigail Cruttenden and Hugh Dennis

programme.title: Queen of Oz
programme.desc: When word gets out that Georgie has been sleeping with one of her staff, she fixes the problem by firing her 'boytoy' Augustus. Georgiana is excited to anticipate her face on the new Australian $5 notes, but when Zoe realises she approved the wrong - and unflattering - portrait, the staff goes into damage control. Hoping to alleviate her constant and ruthless coverage on Steele News, Georgie invites CEO Richard Steele to dinner with the plan to charm him. Matthew suggests she tell Steele she shares his love of hunting, but this plan quickly backfires. Comedy, starring Catherine Tate

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: The Sheffield band perform on the Pyramid stage, their third time headlining the festival and a decade on from their last appearance. Following a huge sold-out world tour and armed with their recent seventh studio album The Car, they are likely to be one of the talking points of this year's event. Songs likely to be performed include Brianstorm, Fluorescent Adolescent, R U Mine? and I Bet That You Look Good on the Dancefloor. Introduced by Jo Whiley and Clara Amfo

programme.title: The Miseducation of Cameron Post (2018)
programme.desc: After teenager Cameron is caught in the backseat of a car with the prom queen, she is sent away to a treatment centre in a remote area called God's Promise. While being subjected to questionable gay conversion therapies, she bonds with fellow residents as they pretend to go along with the process while waiting to be released. Drama, starring Chloe Grace Moretz and John Gallagher Jr

programme.title: Conspiracyland
programme.desc: What happened to the people who fell down the rabbit hole into a world of conspiracy theories during the pandemic? How far have they fallen and how far will they go? The BBC's Disinformation and Social Media correspondent, Marianna Spring, investigates the legacy left by the rise in conspiracy movements in the UK and the media machine at its heart. Travelling across the UK and to Germany, she exposes how radical they have become and how action is spilling offline.

programme.title: North Korea: The Insiders
programme.desc: For more than three years, North Korea has sealed its borders. People are banned from leaving or entering the country. Almost every foreigner who was inside has packed up and left. The world's most secretive and tyrannical state is now an information black hole. For months, three people inside North Korea have risked their lives to tell the BBC what is happening. What they reveal is shocking. People starving to death, years of hard labour for those found watching foreign films and TV programmes, and execution for the ones who try to escape. Jean Mackenzie the BBC's correspondent in South Korea asks: is this a new dark age for North Korea? Part of the award winning Our World strand

programme.title: Women and Gambling: My Secret Addiction
programme.desc: Over the last five years, the number of women seeking help for gambling addiction has more than doubled in the UK, according to the charity GambleAware. As many women grapple with the stigma of addiction, the BBC has been given exclusive access to the first women's residential treatment centre for gambling, based in central England. In this film, Rachel Stonehouse explores the issues around women and gambling addiction, both in the UK and around the world, and asks why it is a secret for so many.

programme.desc: Brian and Jillian move in together, but Stewie interferes with their relationship. Meanwhile, Meg and Chris get jobs at a local convenience store, but she finds herself facing unfair treatment in the workplace. With the voice of Drew Barrymore

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: The principal of the local school tries to improve test scores by expelling its worst pupils, and Lois is outraged when Chris is the first student to get the chop. Peter's fight with a giant chicken continues - but the pair soon realise they have no idea why they are actually quarrelling

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Francine gets a job at Stan's office, which leaves him unable to flirt with his co-workers - and to make matters even worse, jealousy leads to an awful encounter

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan saves Roger's life, but the pair disagree over the chain of events leading to the rescue, resulting in the alien attempting to make a fresh start. Meanwhile, Steve becomes power-hungry when he is given the job of making announcements over the school's PA system

programme.title: Superstore
programme.desc: Cloud 9 employees experience unforeseen problems with the new Zephra app. Dina's texts lead to animosity, and Glenn struggles to deal with a teen craze

programme.title: Superstore
programme.desc: Amy organises a community service event, but it's jeopardized by Jeff's return and Glenn's desire to help his co-workers. Sandra confronts Jonah about his strategy for soliciting donations, whileGarrett tries to prove his intelligence to Dina

programme.title: Tell Me Everything
programme.desc: Mei wants to move back to Canada after the attack from Brett, and when Jonny makes a shock discovery, he decides that he's going to head across the Atlantic too

programme.title: Deep Fake Neighbour Wars
programme.desc: Rihanna and baby Kevin Hart live happily together beside Usain Bolt until his girlfriend - Phoebe Waller-Bridge - arrives on the scene. Adele's awning is under attack from neighbour Jake Paul's pigeons. Impressions show that uses deep fake technology to turn the UK's leading new impressionists into the world's most famous celebrities

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Tricia's world comes crashing down as Marlon tells her what went on while she was away. Laurel withdraws from Ashley, leaving him in a spin, and the Dingles plan Christmas courtesy of the Tates

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Marlon pleads with Tricia not to end their marriage, Laurel strives to forget about Ashley, Chastity receives an irritating phone call and the Dingles fine-tune the details of their robbery

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: It's Joe's last day at the factory, but a goodbye drink with Mike prompts him to question whether he's doing the right thing. Martin catches Sarah and Todd up to no good in the bedroom, and Fiz lets Maria know she's public enemy number one

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: It's all change at Underworld as Joe sacks Hayley and offers Karen the supervisor's job - how will Steve feel about his wife working so closely with her boss? Sarah and Todd finally come clean to Gail about sleeping together, and Sunita offers to take Ciaran in, unaware he's on the run from the Navy

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: The inspector's mother comes to stay, and proves to be a thoroughly unpleasant person. Seventies comedy, starring Stephen Lewis and Bob Grant

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Two women vie for the inspector's affections convinced the stars foretell love. Classic Seventies comedy, starring Stephen Lewis and Bob Grant

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Dr Cheriton has the unenviable task of informing a patient she has little time to live, and the situation soon prompts a hasty wedding ceremony. Arriving at the scene of an accident at the railway station, Dr Ormerod is forced to make a drastic decision, but an oncoming train signals disaster. Medical drama, starring Julian Ovenden, Robert Daws, Bill Maynard and Amy Robbins

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Mr Middleditch is left devastated by news that the hospital is facing closure, and Ormerod finds romance in an unexpected place. A patient who claims to be suffering from amnesia sparks suspicions and Dr Cheriton's housewarming party leads to an unexpected display of passion. Medical drama, starring Julian Ovenden, Ian Carmichael, Robert Daws and Amy Robbins

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An elderly patient's sudden death prompts a series of revelations about his decidedly shady past - and the raid he was planning on Ashfordly Bank. Meanwhile, Craddock is offered the chance of promotion, and Vernon embarks on yet another venture - Scripps' Roaming Holidays. Nostalgic drama, starring Philip Franks, Jason Durr and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: New sergeant Dennis Merton arrives at Ashfordly police station and soon finds himself embroiled in a CID stakeout - but Ventress's shady past threatens the entire operation. Meanwhile, all efforts to pummel David into the peak of physical fitness look set to come to nothing, until a chance encounter knocks Vernon for six. Nostalgic drama, starring William Simons and Duncan Bell

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Marlon vows to win back Tricia, hoping Christmas will offer an opportunity to take her breath away. An unexpected hitch throws the Dingles' plans into disarray, and Pearl has disappointing news for Len

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Zak forces Cain and Charity to call a truce, and Terry is nervous about leaving hospital - much to Dawn's chagrin. Marlon makes a breakthrough with Tricia, while Chastity welcomes her son Aaron to the village

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Karen risks alienating all her friends when she takes the heavy-handed approach on her first day as factory supervisor. Audrey, Archie and Norris form an alliance to discuss their suspicions about Richard, while Peter and Shelley return from holiday to discover Ciaran is still around

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: The factory girls give Karen the silent treatment following the bust-up - so she reacts by threatening to sack Janice, which doesn't go down too well with Mike. Peter offers to help Shelley with the wedding plans - but changes his mind when she talks about getting the flowers from Lucy's shop

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The detective's friend Sir Charles Cartwright (guest star Martin Shaw) hosts a cocktail party at his home in Cornwall, where an amiable local priest chokes to death on his drink. There seems to be no motive for murder, and no trace of poison found in the victim's glass, but weeks later, when Sir Charles's doctor friend Sir Bartholomew Strange dies in similar circumstances, he and Poirot team up to investigate. Drama, with Art Malik, Jane Asher and Anna Carteret, and David Suchet in the title role

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Ventress has his work cut out as a series of crimes linked to an old farming feud turns deadly. But when the evidence fails to add up it is up to the bobbies to prove who is responsible before someone gets killed. Meanwhile, Vernon is inspired to screen films in the village hall. Rural police drama, starring Geoffrey Hughes, William Simons, Tricia Penrose and Jason Durr

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A mysterious visitor is suspected of involvement in the theft of a priceless Ming vase. Mike tries to discover the reason for Merton's visit to headquarters and Gina starts acting like Aidensfield's answer to Mata Hari. Nostalgic drama, guest starring Leslie Grantham

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: A college dean is found bludgeoned to death in local woodland, following a heated pub debate. When an alchemic image is discovered by the body, denoting the first of four stages of a process called 'The Magnum Opus', the detectives realise that there are three more murders to follow. Before any more crimes are committed, the team must uncover the guilty secret that the victims share in order to learn the identity of the killer and the potential victims

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: A former vice cop is found beaten to death, setting Brooks and Devlin off on an investigation through London's seedy underbelly. The victim's widow and his former boss both seem to know more about the murder than they are letting on - but the trail eventually leads to a respectable children's clothes shop. Crime drama, with guest appearances by Sean Pertwee (Cold Feet), Lesley Manville (Cranford) and Juliet Aubrey (Primeval)

programme.title: Innocent
programme.desc: As Sally and Sam grow closer, the police investigation turns to Gary Walker, but what is his connection? Meanwhile, Bethany's link to Matthew comes to light as Karen admits a damning secret. Starring Katherine Kelly, Jamie Bamber and Shaun Dooley

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: Ghosts from the past return to haunt Morse as he investigates the apparent suicide of a terminally ill Oxford don whose widow turns out to be the woman the detective was set to marry in his youth. As the case develops, Lewis worries his partner's professionalism is being undermined. Starring John Thaw and Kevin Whately, with Joanna David, Samantha Bond, David Haig, Adrian Dunbar and James Grout

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Inspector Blake gives Jack a new clippie, knowing her incessant chatter will drive him barmy. Seventies comedy, starring Bob Grant and Stephen Lewis

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Jack suggests Mum should take on the job of cook at the depot canteen. Classic comedy, starring Bob Grant and Stephen Lewis

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Dr Alway says his goodbyes and retires, while Dr Ormerod is devastated to learn his wife has been injured in a coach crash. New assistant administrator Bernard Hussey proves to be quite a handful, local rogue Greengrass is readmitted and Dr Cheriton drops a bombshell on Nurse Taylor. Starring Julian Ovenden, Robert Daws, Wendy Craig and Amy Robbins

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Dr Cheriton and Staff Nurse Taylor attempt to resolve a family dispute on board a fishing trawler. Dr Ormerod struggles to cope with the truth about his wife, and turns for comfort to colleague Jill, who tries to persuade him to take time off work. Meanwhile, Greengrass is shocked to discover he has a long-lost daughter. Drama, starring Robert Daws, Amy Robbins, Wendy Craig and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Ventress has his work cut out as a series of crimes linked to an old farming feud turns deadly. But when the evidence fails to add up it is up to the bobbies to prove who is responsible before someone gets killed. Meanwhile, Vernon is inspired to screen films in the village hall. Rural police drama, starring Geoffrey Hughes, William Simons, Tricia Penrose and Jason Durr

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A mysterious visitor is suspected of involvement in the theft of a priceless Ming vase. Mike tries to discover the reason for Merton's visit to headquarters and Gina starts acting like Aidensfield's answer to Mata Hari. Nostalgic drama, guest starring Leslie Grantham

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Christmas Day dawns to find an uninvited guest in the Dingles' barn, just before the police arrive in search of stolen cash. Cain and Charity end up under the mistletoe, Marlon and Tricia spend the day together and Scott makes a move on Dawn

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Valentine's Day leads to mixed emotions for the residents, as Les dreams of a reconciliation with Janice after receiving an anonymous card through the post, Peter's feelings for Lucy are reignited when he sees her in the street, and Steve finds Karen and Joe alone in the factory

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Les vows to get Janice back, despite her protestations that Mick is now the man for her, and Steve's plans for a romantic day with Karen go up in smoke when Joe turns up on their doorstep. But things are looking up for Sunita and Ciaran - until the police turn up in search of the Irish charmer

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A guest at a village Halloween party boasts of having witnessed a murder years previously - and later meets a grisly end in keeping with the macabre spirit of the occasion. Arriving to investigate, Poirot delves back into the annals of local life - and uncovers a series of mysterious deaths, any one of which could have a bearing on the present case. David Suchet, Amelia Bullmore and Zoe Wanamaker star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A man who has not been heard of in 20 years and was presumed dead suddenly makes an appearance in Aidensfield - and seems not to have aged a day - prompting Merton to cross swords with an old adversary. Meanwhile, Vernon's attempts to bring a taste of France to North Yorkshire are swiftly ruined as a wine connoisseur dishes the dirt on Scripps' vineyards

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Mike gets involved in the troubles of a newcomer and her unruly daughter, only to learn her dark past is about to catch up with her in the form of a ruthless reporter. Meanwhile, Vernon decides there is money to be made from goat's milk. Jason Durr stars

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective is called in when David Kenworthy, the son of a prominent local family, is found murdered on the beach at Whitley Bay. A witness spotted arcade owner Larry Crowe arguing with David on the night of the killing, and a search of the suspect's property uncovers a bloodied baseball bat. However, Larry has a cast-iron alibi and it's clear he wasn't the only person the victim met that night. A second death then leaves Vera facing mounting pressure to crack the case, and struggling to answer the question of why David was drawn to the seafront on the evening of his father's retirement. Brenda Blethyn stars in the murder mystery, with David Leon as her trusty sidekick Joe

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: The discovery of a body in a shallow grave by the Thames prompts Brooks and Devlin to reopen an eight-year-old murder case, casting doubt on a conviction made by Steel at the time. When the imprisoned man, Luke Slade, is given leave to appeal, he represents himself in court - but what starts as a legal battle soon develops into a personal vendetta. Crime drama, guest starring Iain Glen

programme.title: Innocent
programme.desc: With Karen still in police custody, Bethany takes matters into her own hands - making a crucial discovery and forcing a confession. Braithwaite and his team continue their search for more evidence. Sam and Sally come to a decision

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Millionaire Gordon Cloade's wife is widowed for the second time at the tender age of 23, arousing the suspicions of his impoverished relatives. Fanning the flames of envy and hatred, psychic aunt Kathy Cloade reveals the grieving widow's first husband is in fact still alive, and a second death prompts Poirot to delve deeper into the family's dark secrets. David Suchet stars, with Jenny Agutter, Tim Piggot-Smith and Celia Imrie

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Jack and Blakey turn out to be the only entrants in a gardening competition organised by the depot manager's wife. Seventies comedy, starring Bob Grant

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: When their house is subjected to a compulsory purchase order, the Ropers swap urban surroundings for suburbia, where Mildred dreams of climbing the social ladder. George, on the other hand, wants to maintain as low a profile as possible. First episode of the sitcom, starring Yootha Joyce and Brian Murphy

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A teenage boy is brought into the Royal having fallen from a cliff, but it soon emerges that the incident was a suicide attempt as evidence of extreme depression comes to the surface. Dr Cheriton contacts the youngster's psychiatrist, but is taken aback when electroshock therapy is suggested as a form of treatment, so ventures to the family home to recommend an alternative - only for tragedy to strike. Meanwhile, a hypochondriac causes chaos at the hospital when she insists her dog be treated following a snake bite, and a heart-to-heart talk between Drs Weatherill and Ormerod leads to a passionate kiss. Honor Blackman guest stars

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A family hunting expedition ends in a youngster's tragic death, and Ken clashes with Harper over the hospital laundry. Meanwhile, staff at the Royal persuade a devout Catholic mother to be sterilised - much to the disgust of her priest. Drama, starring Robert Daws, Linda Armstrong and Michael Starke

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A man who has not been heard of in 20 years and was presumed dead suddenly makes an appearance in Aidensfield - and seems not to have aged a day - prompting Merton to cross swords with an old adversary. Meanwhile, Vernon's attempts to bring a taste of France to North Yorkshire are swiftly ruined as a wine connoisseur dishes the dirt on Scripps' vineyards

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Mike gets involved in the troubles of a newcomer and her unruly daughter, only to learn her dark past is about to catch up with her in the form of a ruthless reporter. Meanwhile, Vernon decides there is money to be made from goat's milk. Jason Durr stars

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Terry persuades Dawn to visit her mother in Spain, Tricia makes a devastating discovery and Chastity loses her temper with Aaron, which only makes things worse

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Marlon concocts another scheme to win Tricia back, the police approach Eric with disturbing news concerning Gloria, and Aaron deals his mother another blow

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Peter learns stepsister Tracy has got a job at ex-lover Lucy's shop. Ashley finally plucks up the courage to go back home, Steve's jealousy of Karen and Joe grows, and Richard's finances begin to look up

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Peter confronts Lucy about her pregnancy, and is devastated to hear she plans to bring up the child without him. Richard makes plans for a fresh start away from Weatherfield and Karen tries to convince Steve there's nothing going on between her and Joe

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: In Dover, Lieutenant Colin Race is investigating the deaths of two Navy personnel when a distraught Sheila Webb runs out of 19 Wilbraham Crescent and into his arms. Inside the house, Colin finds the body of a murder victim surrounded by stopped clocks. Mystery, starring David Suchet, Anna Massey, Jaime Winstone, Lesley Sharp, Phil Daniels, Geoffrey Palmer and Tessa Peake-Jones

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nicholson delays his 21st-birthday celebrations to join Bellamy in pursuit of two armed and dangerous criminals, but takes one risk too many. Meanwhile, Vernon finds himself blowing his own trumpet after hiring out a brass band to Lord Ashfordly. Rural police drama, starring Ryan Early and Mark Jordon

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Sergeant Merton is suspended following allegations of theft made by a woman he was dating, but Mike believes he is innocent and sets about clearing his name. Meanwhile, Vernon becomes concerned about Bernie's strange behaviour. Rural police drama, starring Duncan Bell, Jason Durr, Jan Francis and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Hypochondriac Malcolm Rayner is struggling with his breathing and Martin asks him if he has ever worked with asbestos. Penhale then causes pandemonium by putting up warning notices about the substance's harmful properties throughout the village. Meanwhile, Bert pops the question to Jennifer, and Ruth finds fault with Al's business proposal. Guest starring Christopher Fairbank (Auf Wiedersehen, Pet)

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The doctor becomes convinced something is wrong with him following a conversation with his mother, and Louisa's attempts at getting him to open up about the loss of his father prove futile. Mrs Tishell goes to the surgery for advice regarding a pain in her jaw, only to find herself falling in love with Martin all over again. Elsewhere, Al receives a visit from two military policemen who are trying to track down Mike Pruddy

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks and Devlin reopen a 25-year-old case when the bones of a young boy are found buried inside the wall of a communal basement. The victim's former best friend takes part in therapy to revisit her memory of the night he disappeared and reveals a shocking secret, but Phillips and Steel worry her claims will not convince a jury. Guest starring Keith Barron and Colin Salmon, with Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber, Freema Agyeman and Ben Daniels

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: An arson attack on a Turkish social club leaves 17 people dead and Brooks, Devlin and Chandler fearing the crime was racially motivated. They uncover a trail of false identities, but face opposition from a respected barrister when they need to remove a key piece of evidence from a suspect's leg. Meanwhile, Steel is forced to confront one of his oldest friends. Guest starring Charles Kay, with Bradley Walsh and Jamie Bamber

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: Lewis joins Morse on a trip to Australia, but it is no holiday - they are pursuing a former supergrass who holds the key to a mystery back in Oxford. Going deep into the heart of the Outback, Morse soon begins to miss the comforts of home, particularly his regular tipple, although Lewis finds he has more in common with his Aussie brethren than he thought. Crime drama, starring John Thaw, Kevin Whately and Con O'Neill

programme.desc: Karen risks alienating all her friends when she takes the heavy-handed approach on her first day as factory supervisor. Audrey, Archie and Norris form an alliance to discuss their suspicions about Richard, while Peter and Shelley return from holiday to discover Ciaran is still around

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: The factory girls give Karen the silent treatment following the bust-up - so she reacts by threatening to sack Janice, which doesn't go down too well with Mike. Peter offers to help Shelley with the wedding plans - but changes his mind when she talks about getting the flowers from Lucy's shop

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Inspector Blake gives Jack a new clippie, knowing her incessant chatter will drive him barmy. Seventies comedy, starring Bob Grant and Stephen Lewis

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Jack suggests Mum should take on the job of cook at the depot canteen. Classic comedy, starring Bob Grant and Stephen Lewis

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Dr Alway says his goodbyes and retires, while Dr Ormerod is devastated to learn his wife has been injured in a coach crash. New assistant administrator Bernard Hussey proves to be quite a handful, local rogue Greengrass is readmitted and Dr Cheriton drops a bombshell on Nurse Taylor. Starring Julian Ovenden, Robert Daws, Wendy Craig and Amy Robbins

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Dr Cheriton and Staff Nurse Taylor attempt to resolve a family dispute on board a fishing trawler. Dr Ormerod struggles to cope with the truth about his wife, and turns for comfort to colleague Jill, who tries to persuade him to take time off work. Meanwhile, Greengrass is shocked to discover he has a long-lost daughter. Drama, starring Robert Daws, Amy Robbins, Wendy Craig and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Ventress has his work cut out as a series of crimes linked to an old farming feud turns deadly. But when the evidence fails to add up it is up to the bobbies to prove who is responsible before someone gets killed. Meanwhile, Vernon is inspired to screen films in the village hall. Rural police drama, starring Geoffrey Hughes, William Simons, Tricia Penrose and Jason Durr

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A mysterious visitor is suspected of involvement in the theft of a priceless Ming vase. Mike tries to discover the reason for Merton's visit to headquarters and Gina starts acting like Aidensfield's answer to Mata Hari. Nostalgic drama, guest starring Leslie Grantham

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Christmas Day dawns to find an uninvited guest in the Dingles' barn, just before the police arrive in search of stolen cash. Cain and Charity end up under the mistletoe, Marlon and Tricia spend the day together and Scott makes a move on Dawn

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Valentine's Day leads to mixed emotions for the residents, as Les dreams of a reconciliation with Janice after receiving an anonymous card through the post, Peter's feelings for Lucy are reignited when he sees her in the street, and Steve finds Karen and Joe alone in the factory

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Les vows to get Janice back, despite her protestations that Mick is now the man for her, and Steve's plans for a romantic day with Karen go up in smoke when Joe turns up on their doorstep. But things are looking up for Sunita and Ciaran - until the police turn up in search of the Irish charmer

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A guest at a village Halloween party boasts of having witnessed a murder years previously - and later meets a grisly end in keeping with the macabre spirit of the occasion. Arriving to investigate, Poirot delves back into the annals of local life - and uncovers a series of mysterious deaths, any one of which could have a bearing on the present case. David Suchet, Amelia Bullmore and Zoe Wanamaker star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A man who has not been heard of in 20 years and was presumed dead suddenly makes an appearance in Aidensfield - and seems not to have aged a day - prompting Merton to cross swords with an old adversary. Meanwhile, Vernon's attempts to bring a taste of France to North Yorkshire are swiftly ruined as a wine connoisseur dishes the dirt on Scripps' vineyards

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Mike gets involved in the troubles of a newcomer and her unruly daughter, only to learn her dark past is about to catch up with her in the form of a ruthless reporter. Meanwhile, Vernon decides there is money to be made from goat's milk. Jason Durr stars

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective is called in when David Kenworthy, the son of a prominent local family, is found murdered on the beach at Whitley Bay. A witness spotted arcade owner Larry Crowe arguing with David on the night of the killing, and a search of the suspect's property uncovers a bloodied baseball bat. However, Larry has a cast-iron alibi and it's clear he wasn't the only person the victim met that night. A second death then leaves Vera facing mounting pressure to crack the case, and struggling to answer the question of why David was drawn to the seafront on the evening of his father's retirement. Brenda Blethyn stars in the murder mystery, with David Leon as her trusty sidekick Joe

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: The discovery of a body in a shallow grave by the Thames prompts Brooks and Devlin to reopen an eight-year-old murder case, casting doubt on a conviction made by Steel at the time. When the imprisoned man, Luke Slade, is given leave to appeal, he represents himself in court - but what starts as a legal battle soon develops into a personal vendetta. Crime drama, guest starring Iain Glen

programme.title: Innocent
programme.desc: With Karen still in police custody, Bethany takes matters into her own hands - making a crucial discovery and forcing a confession. Braithwaite and his team continue their search for more evidence. Sam and Sally come to a decision

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Millionaire Gordon Cloade's wife is widowed for the second time at the tender age of 23, arousing the suspicions of his impoverished relatives. Fanning the flames of envy and hatred, psychic aunt Kathy Cloade reveals the grieving widow's first husband is in fact still alive, and a second death prompts Poirot to delve deeper into the family's dark secrets. David Suchet stars, with Jenny Agutter, Tim Piggot-Smith and Celia Imrie

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A teenage boy is brought into the Royal having fallen from a cliff, but it soon emerges that the incident was a suicide attempt as evidence of extreme depression comes to the surface. Dr Cheriton contacts the youngster's psychiatrist, but is taken aback when electroshock therapy is suggested as a form of treatment, so ventures to the family home to recommend an alternative - only for tragedy to strike. Meanwhile, a hypochondriac causes chaos at the hospital when she insists her dog be treated following a snake bite, and a heart-to-heart talk between Drs Weatherill and Ormerod leads to a passionate kiss. Honor Blackman guest stars

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A family hunting expedition ends in a youngster's tragic death, and Ken clashes with Harper over the hospital laundry. Meanwhile, staff at the Royal persuade a devout Catholic mother to be sterilised - much to the disgust of her priest. Drama, starring Robert Daws, Linda Armstrong and Michael Starke

programme.desc: Terry persuades Dawn to visit her mother in Spain, Tricia makes a devastating discovery and Chastity loses her temper with Aaron, which only makes things worse

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Marlon concocts another scheme to win Tricia back, the police approach Eric with disturbing news concerning Gloria, and Aaron deals his mother another blow

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Peter learns stepsister Tracy has got a job at ex-lover Lucy's shop. Ashley finally plucks up the courage to go back home, Steve's jealousy of Karen and Joe grows, and Richard's finances begin to look up

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Peter confronts Lucy about her pregnancy, and is devastated to hear she plans to bring up the child without him. Richard makes plans for a fresh start away from Weatherfield and Karen tries to convince Steve there's nothing going on between her and Joe

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: In Dover, Lieutenant Colin Race is investigating the deaths of two Navy personnel when a distraught Sheila Webb runs out of 19 Wilbraham Crescent and into his arms. Inside the house, Colin finds the body of a murder victim surrounded by stopped clocks. Mystery, starring David Suchet, Anna Massey, Jaime Winstone, Lesley Sharp, Phil Daniels, Geoffrey Palmer and Tessa Peake-Jones

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nicholson delays his 21st-birthday celebrations to join Bellamy in pursuit of two armed and dangerous criminals, but takes one risk too many. Meanwhile, Vernon finds himself blowing his own trumpet after hiring out a brass band to Lord Ashfordly. Rural police drama, starring Ryan Early and Mark Jordon

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Sergeant Merton is suspended following allegations of theft made by a woman he was dating, but Mike believes he is innocent and sets about clearing his name. Meanwhile, Vernon becomes concerned about Bernie's strange behaviour. Rural police drama, starring Duncan Bell, Jason Durr, Jan Francis and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Hypochondriac Malcolm Rayner is struggling with his breathing and Martin asks him if he has ever worked with asbestos. Penhale then causes pandemonium by putting up warning notices about the substance's harmful properties throughout the village. Meanwhile, Bert pops the question to Jennifer, and Ruth finds fault with Al's business proposal. Guest starring Christopher Fairbank (Auf Wiedersehen, Pet)

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The doctor becomes convinced something is wrong with him following a conversation with his mother, and Louisa's attempts at getting him to open up about the loss of his father prove futile. Mrs Tishell goes to the surgery for advice regarding a pain in her jaw, only to find herself falling in love with Martin all over again. Elsewhere, Al receives a visit from two military policemen who are trying to track down Mike Pruddy

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks and Devlin reopen a 25-year-old case when the bones of a young boy are found buried inside the wall of a communal basement. The victim's former best friend takes part in therapy to revisit her memory of the night he disappeared and reveals a shocking secret, but Phillips and Steel worry her claims will not convince a jury. Guest starring Keith Barron and Colin Salmon, with Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber, Freema Agyeman and Ben Daniels

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: An arson attack on a Turkish social club leaves 17 people dead and Brooks, Devlin and Chandler fearing the crime was racially motivated. They uncover a trail of false identities, but face opposition from a respected barrister when they need to remove a key piece of evidence from a suspect's leg. Meanwhile, Steel is forced to confront one of his oldest friends. Guest starring Charles Kay, with Bradley Walsh and Jamie Bamber

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: Lewis joins Morse on a trip to Australia, but it is no holiday - they are pursuing a former supergrass who holds the key to a mystery back in Oxford. Going deep into the heart of the Outback, Morse soon begins to miss the comforts of home, particularly his regular tipple, although Lewis finds he has more in common with his Aussie brethren than he thought. Crime drama, starring John Thaw, Kevin Whately and Con O'Neill

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil catch up with former house-hunters who were looking for a new start. In 2012, Kirsten and Scott moved from Kirkcaldy after Scott was made redundant and secured a new job in Aberdeen. Kirstie managed to find them a rural cottage close to Scott's work. Nine years, several moves and a few job changes later, the pair are back in Kirkcaldy where Kirstie catches up with them. In 2020, Digi had a big budget and even bigger expectations. She was looking for a country pile near London with outbuildings for both her businesses that was close to daughter Emily's school and full of character. Having a medical condition meant her new home also had to be fully accessible. Kirstie rose to the challenge but Digi realised if she wanted to find the perfect property she would have to expand her search. Two years later, Phil visits Digi in her new home in Abingdon to see if she managed to find her dream place

programme.title: Extraordinary Escapes with Sandi Toksvig
programme.desc: Sandi and comedian, actor and writer Roisin Conaty explore Wales from the Pembrokeshire Coast to the English border staying in the best retreats the country has to offer. Starting with Seren Mor near the Nevern Estuary, Roisin is blown away by the contemporary architecture and dogs on the beach. Electric bikes take the pair over to Powys where they stay at the Hergest Lee Cabin and Lean-To, styled with quirky design and mid-century furnishings. Finally, the pair top off their escape in Moor Tower, a refurbished folly by Hay on Wye just a mile from the Welsh boarder boasting views of the Black Mountains, The Brecon Beacons and the Wye Valley

programme.title: The Change
programme.desc: Comedy starring Bridget Christie. When 50-year-old mother of two, Linda is told what she thought was early onset dementia is actually menopause, she decides to do something for herself for a change and reconnect with the person that she used to be

programme.title: The Change
programme.desc: Linda's tranquil journey into the forest in search for a time capsule she hid there as a child is interrupted by Pig Man, a recluse who lives in the woods with only wild boar for company

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Maître d' Fred Sirieix and his team prepare once again to play Cupid at their Manchester restaurant. Essex-born cleaning fanatic Fleur is paired with Essex boy Louis, who reveals he has been working as a high-end escort. Thirty five-year-old Ian, from Co Durham, is full of contradictions, which include working as a gas fitter while also running an art gallery with a champagne bar. it remains to be seen if similarly-aged medical lab assistant Michaela could be the woman to love all of his quirks

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Cameras follow junior doctor Ming, who for the first time in his career carries out a needle aspiration on a 19-year-old patient brought into A&E with a collapsed lung. A woman who is 17 weeks pregnant falls down the stairs, and fears the accident may lead to a possible miscarriage. She recounts her struggles to conceive, and fears that if this pregnancy fails, she may never have a child

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A man with a deep cut to the head refuses to go to hospital for fear that he won't come out again. It's not often the paramedics treat a patient who runs off, but that's what happens when they're called to a suspected drug overdose. A homeless man is in agony with spasms in his back, and a 12-year-old girl with epilepsy has a seizure, but her mother still wants her to go to school

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In West Yorkshire, Stacey and Tom kick things off with a traditional European menu, with Stacey forced to confront her fears and handle chicken livers for the first time. Robin and wife Kaz steal the night with terrible jokes and comedy false teeth, while bemused Kiwi couple Leigh and Toni wonder at some of the humour. The second day sees Leigh and Toni preparing their Italian-themed menu in the tiny galley of their barge, but the biggest worry is the rabbit main course. programme.desc: Part one of two. The documentary focuses on the importation of huge quantities of Class A drugs, following the work of covert detectives from the Eastern Region Special Operation Unit. A consignment weighing more than 100kg has been intercepted while being imported into the UK from Europe. To reveal who is behind this, an undercover operation is authorised to closely monitor the shipment, using audio and visual equipment, as it travels to its final destination at a farm in rural Hertfordshire

programme.title: Moors Murders
programme.desc: Following the arrest of Brady for a single murder, police discover a tape recording of a 10-year-old girl being tortured and realise they are investigating a string of murders. Eyewitness Clive Entwistle describes the first police search of the moors above Manchester. He was present when the remains of the girl on the tape were found, and explains how police used photographs of the serial-killing couple posing on the moors to locate the body of the third known victim, a 12-year-old boy

Alliances are broken then re-made, and then an act of betrayal amid a terrifying battle transforms the course of history

programme.title: Hannibal (2001)

Ridley Scott's thriller sequel, starring Anthony Hopkins, Julianne Moore, Gary Oldman and Ray Liotta

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Regular patient Tina comes to see Dr Sobia Wyne, having been diagnosed with cirrhosis of the liver and the possibility of Hepatitis C. Tina reveals she has been told that if she does not stop drinking, she will be dead in three months. Meanwhile, a patient complains about pain in his left arm when he walks too fast, and paramedic Kim Bick sees a 12-year-old girl who has stopped eating after having tonguetie surgery.

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: On the outskirts of Chesterfield, Jim responds to an urgent call for back-up from his colleague Tom, who is surrounded by an angry mob following a report of a teenager driving dangerously. The aggressive young man, emboldened by an equally hostile crowd of friends, has no insurance and when police decide to seize and tow his car away, he takes out his frustrations on his own vehicle

programme.title: Britain's Great Cathedrals with Tony Robinson
programme.desc: The actor recounts the history of Winchester Cathedral, the longest medieval cathedral in northern Europe, which has witnessed civil wars, religious battles and struggled with collapsing foundations. It is the burial place of novelist Jane Austen - though only four people attended her funeral and originally her plaque made no mention of her writing. Tony learns that Winchester's bishops were among the richest, most influential and most badly behaved in the country and some were wealthier and more powerful than even England's kings

programme.title: Divine Designs
programme.desc: Art historian Professor Paul Binski presents an examination of Britain's religious architecture and culture, focusing on the treasures of Winchester Cathedral, the Norman showpiece designed to rival the glories of St Peter's in Rome

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Bugles in the Afternoon (1952)
programme.desc: A disgraced cavalryman tries to redeem himself by returning to active service at a fort in the middle of Sioux territory, unaware the commanding officer is an arch-enemy from the past. Antagonism grows as they both fall for the same woman, and the newcomer finds himself assigned to ever more dangerous missions by his commander, who hopes he will fail to return from them. Western, with Ray Milland, Helena Carter and Hugh Marlowe

programme.title: Hobson's Choice (1953)
programme.desc: A cantankerous, overbearing boot-maker spends most of his time drinking while his three daughters push themselves to the limit taking care of his shop and home. A timid employee marries one of the sisters, then sets himself up as a rival for his business. Comedy, starring John Mills and Charles Laughton

programme.title: Apache Uprising (1965)
programme.desc: Western, starring Rory Calhoun as a tough-talking cowboy with a heart of gold who bravely defends fellow stagecoach passengers from a potentially lethal Indian attack. Also starring Corinne Calvet, Lon Chaney Jr and John Russell

programme.title: Fantastic Mr Fox (2009)
programme.desc: A rebellious fox decides it is time to grow up and change his chicken-stealing ways for the sake of his wife and children. However, the presence of three wicked farmers near his woodland home proves a challenge he cannot resist. Stop-motion animated adventure based on the novel by Roald Dahl, with the voices of George Clooney, Meryl Streep, Jason Schwartzman and Bill Murray

programme.title: Asteroid City Interview Special
programme.desc: An interview with Jason Schwartzman, Jake Ryan, Hope Davis and Steve Park about working with Wes Anderson on his new film Asteroid City

programme.title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Voyage of the Dawn Treader (2010)
programme.desc: Lucy and Edmund Pevensie return to the magical world accompanied by their selfish cousin. They join their old friend King Caspian as he sets sail across the sea in search of seven of his father's allies who had been banished years before, but along the way they discover an evil force is growing in strength. Fantasy adventure, with Georgie Henley, Skandar Keynes, Will Poulter and Ben Barnes

programme.title: London Has Fallen (2016)
programme.desc: World leaders gather in London for the funeral of the British Prime Minister, unaware they have been led into a trap. A terrorist plans to kill them all, and devastate the city, and the only people in a position to stop him are the President of the United States and the indomitable head of his secret service. Action thriller sequel to Olympus Has Fallen, starring Gerard Butler, Aaron Eckhart and Morgan Freeman

programme.title: The Hate U Give (2018)
programme.desc: Starr Carter lives in two worlds - the poor, black neighbourhood where she resides and the mostly white prep school she attends. When she witnesses the fatal shooting of her childhood friend by a policeman, Starr must find her voice and stand up for what's right. Drama, starring Amandla Stenberg, Regina Hall and Russell Hornsby

programme.title: Sweet Country (2017)
programme.desc: An aged Aboriginal farmhand shoots a white man in self defence and goes on the run as a posse gathers to hunt him down. Australian period drama, starring Hamilton Morris, Bryan Brown and Sam Neill

programme.title: A Town Like Alice (1956)
programme.desc: Second World War PoW Jean Paget is sent on a gruelling forced march between Japanese labour camps, but finds comfort in her friendship with Australian captive Joe Harman. During the journey Joe is caught stealing, tied to a cross and left to die. After the conflict is over, Jean is startled to receive a letter postmarked in Joe's home town of Alice Springs. Jack Lee's drama, based on the novel by Nevil Shute, starring Virginia McKenna, Peter Finch, Takagi and Jean Anderson

programme.title: Ice Cold in Alex (1958)
programme.desc: The crew and passengers of an ambulance become stranded in the Libyan desert and face a perilous journey back to civilisation. Leading the trek is an alcoholic army captain, who vows to remain sober until he has completed the task - but his resolve is threatened by a stranger they rescue who is secretly an enemy spy. Second World War drama, with John Mills, Sylvia Syms, Anthony Quayle and Harry Andrews

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility (1995)
programme.desc: An impoverished family is taken in by a relative - and while sensible elder daughter Elinor's love for the sensitive Edward Ferrars meets with disapproval from his family, her more passionate younger sister Marianne engages in a disastrous romance with an infamous womaniser. Period drama based on Jane Austen's novel, directed by Ang Lee and starring Emma Thompson, Kate Winslet, Alan Rickman and Hugh Grant

programme.title: Risen (2016)
programme.desc: A Roman officer and his assistant are charged with investigating what became of Jesus' body following the crucifixion, as the Roman hierarchy fears stories of a resurrected Messiah may lead to an uprising in Jerusalem. However, what they discover during their search forces them to question everything they believe. Biblical drama, starring Joseph Fiennes and Tom Felton

programme.title: Angel Has Fallen (2019)
programme.desc: Secret Service agent Mike Banning finds himself framed for an assassination attempt on the President. Pursued by his own agency and the FBI, Banning races to clear his name and uncover the real terrorist threat - which has set its sights on Air Force One. Action thriller sequel, starring Gerard Butler and Morgan Freeman

programme.title: The First Purge (2018)
programme.desc: The US government trials a controversial experiment to legalise all crime for one night. Thriller prequel, starring Y'lan Noel, Lex Scott Davis, Joivan Wade and Marisa Tomei

programme.title: Joe Strummer: The Future Is Unwritten (2007)
programme.desc: Documentary examining the life and music of the frontman of the Clash. The film combines archive interviews with the musician with contributions from friends and admirers, including Mick Jagger, Johnny Depp, John Cusack, Steve Buscemi and Bono

programme.title: Reach for the Sky (1956)
programme.desc: Biopic of Second World War hero Douglas Bader. A plane crash in 1931 cost the aspiring pilot both his legs, but after learning to walk on artificial limbs, he went on to become one of the RAF's most decorated heroes. However, more misfortune was in store when he was shot down over occupied France and taken prisoner. Starring Kenneth More, Muriel Pavlow and Alexander Knox

programme.title: Last Train from Gun Hill (1959)
programme.desc: A marshal discovers the man responsible for raping and killing his wife is actually the son of an old friend, setting the scene for a showdown. Western, starring Kirk Douglas, Anthony Quinn, Brian Hutton and Carolyn Jones

programme.title: The Guns of Navarone (1961)
programme.desc: An elite group of Allied soldiers is dispatched to sabotage vital German artillery emplacements, despite the seemingly insurmountable odds and the suspicion there is a traitor in their midst. Oscar-winning Second World War adventure, based on Alistair MacLean's novel, starring Gregory Peck, David Niven, Anthony Quinn, Stanley Baker, Anthony Quayle and Irene Papas

programme.title: My Spy (2020)
programme.desc: Special Forces operative turned spy JJ undertakes covert surveillance of Kate Newton, the sister-in-law of a terrorist. JJ is ordered to keep a low profile. Unfortunately, Kate's resourceful nine-year-old daughter Sophie blows his cover and blackmails JJ into training her as a spy. Comedy, starring Dave Bautista and Chloe Coleman

programme.title: Red Sparrow (2018)
programme.desc: Dominika Egorova, a ballerina struggling to support her ill mother, is recruited to a Russian intelligence service, where she is trained to use her body as a weapon. Her first mission, targeting a CIA agent, threatens to unravel the security of both nations. Spy thriller based on Jason Matthews' novel, starring Jennifer Lawrence, Joel Edgerton, Matthias Schoenaerts and Jeremy Irons

programme.title: Planet Terror (2007)
programme.desc: A disaster at a military base releases a toxic gas on a small town, turning anyone exposed to it into ravenous flesh-eating mutants. A small band of survivors, including a one-legged stripper and a duplicitous bounty hunter, fight their way through the hordes of monsters threatening to overrun the town. Sci-fi thriller, paying homage to low budget B-movies of the 1970s, starring Rose McGowan, Freddy Rodriguez and Josh Brolin

programme.title: Buffalo Soldiers (2001)
programme.desc: American soldier Ray Elwood leads a comfortable life in Cold War Germany, selling everything from cleaning products to heroin on the black market, with his weak-willed commanding officer blissfully unaware. However, everything changes when a tough new sergeant arrives determined to clean up the base, while a profitable arms deal and the new arrival's teenage daughter only complicate matters further. Black comedy drama, with Joaquin Phoenix, Ed Harris, Anna Paquin and Scott Glenn

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Sally puts her foot in it, and Warren faces a revelation that leaves him raging. Meanwhile, Charlie is encouraged to make another bad decision

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: A torn family is pulled even further apart when a concerned sister does what she thinks is right. Things start looking up for Warren in both his business and love life

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay comes to the aid of Lela's, a Pomona, California, restaurant that is currently being run into the ground by its inexperienced owner. Gordon tries to turn the failing business around, but faces opposition from the chef and makes enemies when he exposes the suspect behaviour of some members of staff

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef tries to transform the fortunes of Sebastian's, a pizzeria in Burbank, Los Angeles, which is failing to attract customers, leaving the owner in debt and struggling to support his family. Gordon is horrified to discover pre-processed and frozen ingredients on the menu, but there seems to be little he can do to help when he is thrown out of the kitchen

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Following a tragic accident in the local community, Mary's faith is shaken. Seeing his mother doubt everything she believes, Sheldon becomes an unlikely ally. Comedy, starring Iain Armitage and Zoe Perry

programme.title: Young Sheldon

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is awarded a prestigious prize by the university, but is scared of collecting the gong at a ceremony because he knows he'll have to give a speech. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard tells Penny he loves her, but fails to get the response he would have liked. Sheldon also finds himself competing against Star Trek: The Next Generation actor Wil Wheaton once again when the gang goes bowling - and tries to get his revenge

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Dunphys are flying home from a weekend away, but Phil is less than happy when Claire takes the only first-class seat available. Mitch and Cam throw a belated baby shower for their friend Sal, and are surprised to find that motherhood seems to have changed her, and Jay shows Manny how to defend himself against a bully in his cooking class. Elizabeth Banks, Nathan Lane and Penn Jillette guest star

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire is stuck at an airport and needs to track down Haley, who has gone missing following an argument, so she logs on to her laptop and checks in with the rest of the family in the hope of making amends with her daughter. Julie Bowen stars in a novel episode filmed entirely on Apple devices, with Ty Burrell, Ed O'Neill and Sarah Hyland

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard's purchase of a dining-room table causes Sheldon to re-evaluate his life. Meanwhile, Howard is offered the chance to go back to the International Space Station, and Bernadette struggles to decide whether to encourage him.
