John and Della McGinn are wowed by the decor, but Phil and Sharon Hobson are less impressed by their bathroom. During an afternoon rugby training session, Mark and Lowrie Price surprise their rivals. Foodie John puts Steve to the test at breakfast, and Steve and Kathy find Phil's 'sausage feedback' hard to swallow

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the pet-friendly Dog in a Doublet in Peterborough, where Della McGinn's passion for animals comes a close second to husband John's passion for food

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at the Torcroft Boutique B&B in Torquay, south Devon, where Phil and Sharon Hobson hope their added extras will help win over their rivals

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay is at the 600-year-old Rhydspence Inn in Herefordshire, where the medieval character proves charming, although the everyday practicalities prove painful for some

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of competition sees the B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and to settle some scores. Copper Beech House are first to host and Steve and Kathy want Phil to swallow his synthetic sausage comment

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: As autumn sets in, Dick and Angel harvest their pumpkins in the walled garden and organise a family wheelbarrow race. The basement is the latest room to be transformed, serving as a nerve centre for the whole chateau, a space for storing deliveries, and Dick's workshop. The old piggery is also renovated, in anticipation of some new arrivals

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Daily life inside Woodgreen animal charity, following staff who are committed to matching their homeless dogs with prospective owners. Patch the border collie displays an impressive array of tricks to try to convince horse groomer Megan that he's a smart choice for her. Pebbles the Lhasa is a firm sofa addict and a bit on the chunky side. She's matched with David, a Paralympian and workaholic

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows Matt and Sophie White from Sussex as they build a giant family house of fun for themselves and their children. Going against the norm of designing a serious and practical home, the couple's property features a revolving bookcase door, secret dens, hiding places and a fireman's pole. Matt uses a steel frame system to allow them to change the layout of the property, and other changes include amending the window shapes and sizes, and adding a half floor to create a James Bond room

programme.title: Fortress Britain with Alice Roberts
programme.desc: Professor Alice Roberts, Professor Danielle George and Dr Onyeka Nubia examines surviving evidence of Britain's preparation for a Nazi land invasion during the Second World War, including the tragic story of one of the war's forgotten heroines. Alice learns about the deployment of the Home Guard, and Danielle travels to the Channel Islands to visit the only concentration camp to be built on British soil

programme.title: Skeletons of the Mary Rose: The New Evidence
programme.desc: Scientists and historians use isotope and DNA analysis to identify the crew of Henry VIII's flagship, which sank off the coast of Portsmouth in 1545. With the help of Mary Rose Trust curator Alex Hildred, the programme uncovers evidence that many of the sailors were of African origin, and traces surviving descendants of the only two members of the crew who can be identified by name. Plus, the little-known story of a 16th-century Guinean free-diver who retrieved several treasures from the wreck

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A look at the night shift in a busy A&E department. A woman with a severe form of autism is brought in, having suffered an injury to one of her fingers. While she is treated, her sister shares stories of their childhood and the challenges their family have faced. An 82-year-old patient has difficulty breathing, and doctors suspect he has developed life-threatening sepsis and need to act fast to try to halt the spread of infection

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Air ambulance crew members take drastic steps to reset a patient's dangerously fast heartbeat, a cyclist crashes in a remote area, and a motorist is injured in a road accident

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the game show mash-up, with Rachel Riley and Susie Dent. Jon Richardson and Sara Pascoe take on Sean Lock and Richard Ayoade. Nick Helm joins Susie in Dictionary Corner

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A look at the night shift in a busy A&E department. A woman with a severe form of autism is brought in, having suffered an injury to one of her fingers. While she is treated, her sister shares stories of their childhood and the challenges their family have faced. An 82-year-old patient has difficulty breathing, and doctors suspect he has developed life-threatening sepsis and need to act fast to try to halt the spread of infection

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty finds out that shellfish consumed by millions have been feeding on plastic discarded in the sea, with shocking global implications. Kate Quilton finds out whether the makers of Marmite can really predict whether people will love or hate their distinctive yeast-based spread, as claimed in their latest TV advert, and Tebbutt aims to solve the age-old mystery of how to smoothly extract ketchup from a bottle - by running across a pond of custard

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp enters the single-cake class at the Devon County Show, and hopes to win over the judges with her own Caribbean-inspired recipe. However, it is a fellow competitor's beetroot cake that ends up raising their eyebrows

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: With their children flying the nest, Andy and Alida have decided now is the time to fulfil their dream of buying a chalet in the French Alps. They are downsizing their house in Wokingham, Surrey, and splitting the funds between the UK and France, so Laura Hamilton and Jonnie Irwin have been sent on a joint mission. With a total of £650,000 to spend, and three shots each to find the perfect property - Laura in Berkshire and Jonnie in the ski-resort of Morzine - the pressure is really on for both of them to deliver

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: It's the height of the season for the expats chasing a new life abroad. In Portugal, the brewery opens its tap room, and there's a launch party at the B&B in Andalusia. A swimming pool gets delivered to the French spa, and an event starts in the dark at the yurt restaurant in Italy

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien are in Wales, where they pick up and restore a dentist's table and a barber's chair, and make a coffee table out of parquet flooring

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel around Britain to find items to fix up and flog on to make a profit for their owners. In the Cotswolds, the duo compete to see who can create the most profit on two old lamps and take a spin in a Devonshire fire engine

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: A Tooting man discovers an ancestor was one of Britain's early tobacco merchants. While on the case of a retired Post Office worker, a visit to his flat leads to a discovery

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The team searches for relatives of a deceased boat fanatic, while another estate sees a family awarded an inheritance for a second time in three years

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at the White Horse Inn in Maldon, Essex, where owners Jayne and Pete Kocinoga hope their attention to detail will win over their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Barnfield B&B in St Osyth, Essex, run by Christine and Paul, where as well as offering rooms, Christine also runs spiritual retreats

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week the contestants head to The Black Swan Inn in Pickering, North Yorkshire, where husband and wife Phil and Jill Hall hope to impress their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay is at Delamere Farm near Peterborough, where proud owner Agi Chapman is sent into a spin after hearing some critical comments over breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day arrives, and the hosts of The White Horse Inn, Barnfield B&B, The Black Swan Inn and Delamere Farm all discover just how much their guests valued their services

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: A look back at the transformation of Dick and Angel's 45-room chateau in France from abandoned ruin to sumptuous family home. The series begins by recalling the technical and engineering challenges they had to overcome to make it habitable for their young family. The couple remember their first winter together, when Dick's ingenious solutions were put to the test

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Woodgreen animal charity staff set about matching their homeless dogs with more prospective owners. Eighty-five-year-old Pim thinks Dexter the beagle is as stubborn as Elizabeth, his wife of 62 years. It's possible that shy Jack Russell Roxy could prove a better match. Chihuahuas Bear and Dave try to convince seven-year-old husky-fan Ollie that two little dogs are better than one

programme.title: Grand Designs: Living in
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud looks at the challenges of self-building in the countryside, where design must embrace and enhance tradition, yet often overcome stringent planning constraints. Drawing on footage from the show, as well as new visits to extraordinary homes, he finds out how pioneers at the forefront of architecture are transforming agricultural and historic buildings, and bringing cutting-edge contemporary design to rural parts

programme.title: The Great British Dig: History in Your Back Garden
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis and the team visit Studley Royal Park in North Yorkshire, on a quest to find the lost Georgian mansion that would have been at the heart of the world class Water Gardens, which still exist today. The house and gardens were created by John Aislabie, but his house has vanished from the landscape and the only clue the team has to go on is a fallen tree that's revealed some mysterious bricks. With the help of the local community, the team uncovers the foundations of this Georgian mansion and finds out about the grand lives of the family who once lived there

programme.title: George Clarke's Remarkable Renovations
programme.desc: The architect meets Bernie, who has bought a ramshackle stable on the banks of the Humber and plans to turn it into a luxury home for his retirement. Originally a large stable block serving a grand Victorian estate nearby, it comprises a saddle room, stalls and a tack room, but having only served as a home for horses, turning it into a luxury house is a brave move

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Doctors investigate the underlying medical conditions that may have caused a motorist to crash into a lamppost, while the patient's son and his friend recount the influence she has had on both their lives. A man who fell during the night is treated for possible head trauma, and the father of a three-year-old patient reveals how his stepfather inspired him to be the best parent he can be

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp demonstrates how to create handmade and personalised gifts. She learns about sugarcraft and perfume-making, and also receives a lesson in the art of designing Victorian-style silhouettes

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Deputy head teacher Emma wants to buy a new family home for her and her three children in the West Sussex countryside, and also a bolthole in Languedoc-Roussillon in the south of France, where she can escape to during the school holidays to pen her first novel. Laura Hamilton has three terrific properties in Sussex for Emma's UK budget of £320,000, while Ben Hillman, who has £120,000 to spend, lines up three tempting options in France

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: The season reaches its end for the intrepid expats. In France, a spa owner crowns her business dream as she throws open her doors for the first time. programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel around Britain to find items to fix up and flog on to make a profit for their owners. In this episode, Henry finds a treat for restorer Guy, and Simon creates stunning table lamps from old theatre lights

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The search for a Kent woman's relatives runs into difficulties on her father's side of the family. The team uncovers the story of a naval hero during a case in Wales

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: Friends of a glamorous south London woman who once travelled the world, call in the probate detectives to try to find her family. Meanwhile, the search for relatives of a silk weaver's son is jeopardised by a surprise revelation. Plus, details of two unclaimed estates where heirs still need to be found

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The latest competition starts at Martyn and Elaine Flint's lovingly decorated, adults-only B&B, the Hillcroft in Torquay. Elaine faces a tough time in the kitchen and the feedback turns up the heat

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Grand Designs: Living in

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

Having concluded their primary appeal is to caravanners, the duo spend a couple of days in models by Mazda and Volkswagen and try to get a feel for what life is like for the people they believe would buy one. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond drives a pair of exciting Lamborghinis in Italy - the ferocious Aventador Roadster and the limited-edition Sesto Elemento, which carries an eye-watering price tag of around £2million. Two cars are also put through their paces on the test track, with James in a modern re-creation of the classic Porsche 911 and Aerosmith frontman Steven Tyler in the rather less exotic Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Meth is found inside a truck driver's speakers, a Mexican boy claiming US citizenship is questioned, and AC units containing drugs are intercepted.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson drives the Jaguar F-Type sports car on some of Britain's finest roads, while Richard Hammond jumps inside the Range Rover Sport and gives it a thorough workout off-road, on a track and in what he believes is its most natural habitat - the lanes of Cheshire. James May goes for a countryside adventure in the New Routemaster London bus brought into use in 2013, which is propelled by a turbodiesel generator and a powerful electric motor. Inspired by the machines they have tested, the trio then meet to celebrate Britain's motor industry with a grand finale in front of Buckingham Palace. Plus, former Formula One driver Mark Webber takes to the track for a lap in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May immerse themselves in nostalgia and try to prove that hot hatches from their younger days are better than today's equivalents. Jeremy grabs the keys to a Volkswagen Golf GTI, Richard takes the wheel of a Vauxhall Nova SRi and James May opts for the Ford Fiesta XR2i, and the trio set off on a road trip that includes a hill climb and a visit to a supermarket. However, their adventure concludes at an army training ground in Wales, where they and their steeds must face the heavily armed Top Gear Police Department. Downton Abbey star Hugh Bonneville blasts the Reasonably Priced Car around the test track

programme.title: Lazy Boy Garage
programme.desc: Jonny thinks he can turn a profit on the relatively unknown Seat 600 and purchases one from Barcelona, as the Lazy Boys try to tap into the market for bubble cars

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer return to Scotland for their latest fishing trip. Having failed to catch a salmon in the River Tay, they hope to have more luck on the Tweed. They begin their journey at the isolated Bemersyde Estate before moving on to the Bridge Pool at Kelso, one of the most famous salmon fishing spots in Scotland. They also try their hand at boat fishing and receive some mystical predictions from a familiar face

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer are joined by Feargal Sharkey for a trip to the River Lea in Hertfordshire, where Paul used to fish for perch with his friends when he was a teenager. Bob reads up on the wise words of 17th-century angler Izaak Walton and prepares a riverside picnic that brings back fond memories and leads to a reflection on the differences between teenage life in their 1970s youth and the present. Setting up home in a narrowbooat, he also prepares a dish Paul's mother used to make - corned beef and potato pie

programme.desc: A look at the early stages of genocide at the camp, examining the role of commander Rudolf Hoess in the process. Featuring contributions from survivors

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo braves the freezing temperatures of the Baltic Sea and finds peace paddling a canoe on the Lakes of Finland. On his journey from the Latvian capital Riga to Tampere in Finland, he encounters medieval knights in Tallinn, grills sausages in Helsinki and samples cloudberry liqueur in a hot tub. He later arrives in Estonia, where in the setting of a ruined 13th-century cathedral he learns how the Baltic countries demonstrated their desire for independence from the Soviet Union with a 'singing revolution'

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels between Liverpool and Wales. In Snowdonia, he also rides the waves with a Welsh surfing champion

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In picturesque Snowdonia, Michael Portillo braves the fastest zip line in the world - stretching 1,500 feet across a vast slate quarry as he begins the last leg of his journey to Caernarfon. En route, he also visits the home of British mountaineering, Pen y Gwryd, to hear how an Edwardian journalist and poet created a climbing community, which grew to include men who would conquer Everest in the 1950s

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution

By this point, the Allies were aware of Auschwitz's purpose, and faced a difficult decision over what should be done about it. Plus, the story of the occupation of Hungary, revealing how Adolf Eichmann offered to spare a million Jews in return for certain services

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the second leg of his journey from Preston to Kirkcaldy, returning to the historic Settle-Carlisle line he helped save from dereliction when he was Minister of State for Transport in the 1980s. Here, engineer Tony Feshini describes what life was like for the people who originally built Ribblehead Viaduct, before Michael visits Dent, Cumbria, home to the highest railway station in England

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey following George Bradshaw's footsteps, as the third leg of his trip from Preston to Kirkcaldy sees him embarking on a two-day tour of the Lake District. He begins in Windermere, where he travels by steamboat to the north of the lake, and continues to Claife viewing station, where he learns about the water pollution caused by increasing levels of tourism. He spends the night in Grasmere, and the following day reaches Kendal, where he buys local delicacies and meets a farmer who explains the impact of railways on farming practices

programme.title: The Yorkshire Steam Railway: All Aboard
programme.desc: Preparations are under way for Yorkshire Day, including a special Yorkshire-themed Pullman service, with Gill and husband Paul getting hands-on sorting out the event. There is also another big occasion on the horizon and Tim is organising the wedding of head boilersmith Mark and his equally steam-mad fiancée Emma. Their love blossomed because of mutual passion for steam, and in particular the B1, so they want the engine to pull them on their wedding train, but issues with the engine means it might miss the big day

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives at a milestone on his American journey as he reaches the boundary between the northern and southern states, known as the Mason-Dixon line. Beginning in Wilmington, North Carolina, he uncovers the history of gunpowder production in Delaware, before heading to Baltimore, where he discovers how the first American steam engine owed a lot to British technology. On the city's east coast, Michael visits the star-shaped Fort McHenry, and learns how the Star-Spangled Banner national anthem was born

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: Derek gets a tour of Hadlow Castle in Kent when he arrives to collect the owner's pre-war Alvis and an immaculate Citroen used by the Gestapo in occupied France

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring a luxury resort that conceals a top-secret facility, a mysterious complex in Bali struck by disaster, and a relic of hope near Jerusalem

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the second leg of his journey from Preston to Kirkcaldy, returning to the historic Settle-Carlisle line he helped save from dereliction when he was Minister of State for Transport in the 1980s. Here, engineer Tony Feshini describes what life was like for the people who originally built Ribblehead Viaduct, before Michael visits Dent, Cumbria, home to the highest railway station in England

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey following George Bradshaw's footsteps, as the third leg of his trip from Preston to Kirkcaldy sees him embarking on a two-day tour of the Lake District. He begins in Windermere, where he travels by steamboat to the north of the lake, and continues to Claife viewing station, where he learns about the water pollution caused by increasing levels of tourism. He spends the night in Grasmere, and the following day reaches Kendal, where he buys local delicacies and meets a farmer who explains the impact of railways on farming practices

programme.desc: How the world's biggest ships manage to get the job done, beginning with the Saipem 7000 as she sails from Stavanger in Norway to the Ula Oilfields

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Police communications officer Esther Kennedy hosts the third dinner party in Medway, Kent. She has very high standards and believes everything has to be just so, with nice cutlery, matching plates and impeccable glassware. But the key thing is her gourmet menu, which may or may not prove a hit with her fellow diners. However, Esther does end the night by treating her guests to an impromptu rock performance

On the second night, Brian and Victoria host with a 'vaguely' Scottish theme, but things don't exactly go as planned when Andrew reveals he doesn't like spice or lentils, both of which are on the menu. Finally, it's David and Sarah's turn to impress with a menu that represents their heritage, with dishes from Russia, Armenia and a Scottish/American dessert

programme.desc: Jean Johansson travels to La Zenia in Alicante to help house hunters Alan and Julie find the perfect holiday home, linking up five properties for their budget of £140,000

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien and Henry Cole visit Lincolnshire to meet mangle collector Colin, who's trying to find a home for his late father's possessions, including a motorbike won in a raffle

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition comes from in and around Belfast, where the first host is chatty PR manager Claire. She aims to impress with a menu made up of her favourite restaurant dishes, but never having plucked a pheasant before, she has a challenge on her hands. The guests she's hoping to impress are DJ Ryan, joiner and part-time inventor Neil, charity events manager Cailin, and window cleaning manager Paul, on a lively night filled with laughter, music and dancing

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Carpenter Neil hosts the second dinner party in and around Belfast in a bid to win the £1000 prize, presenting good old fashioned, country style cuisine to his guests. With a farmyard full of animals joining in the fun, discussions ranging from disabled chickens to eating stinging nettles and a guest performance from Neil's very own creation, ''head in a jar', it's proves to be a weird and wonderful experience out in the countryside

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Debonair window cleaning business owner and keen golfer Paul has cut a dash already this week in and around Belfast with his sense of style, and now he hopes to impress with his fine food. For Ryan and Neil, most of the fancy fare is uncharted territory, and while Cailin and Claire are impressed with the fine dining, Paul sails close to the wind when he suggests that they might like to be his ladies-in-waiting

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Livewire DJ and events organiser Ryan is the next to host in and around Belfast - and having arranged parties for thousands, is confident he can satisfy four fellow diners. Eccentric joiner Neil anticipates a madcap evening of fun, and with a hipster band playing in the living room, unexpected discoveries in the bedroom and several crises in the kitchen, certainly gets the entertainment he was hoping for

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night in Belfast, Cailin hosts a Eurovision extravaganza. Her rivals have provided top-notch nosh and entertainment, but she believes that her tried-and-tested dishes from across Europe will land her the top spot

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jean Johansson travels to La Zenia in Alicante to help house hunters Alan and Julie find the perfect holiday home, linking up five properties for their budget of £140,000

programme.title: Britain's Most Luxurious Train Journeys
programme.desc: A guide to luxury train rides across Britain, beginning with the steam-hauled Saphos train on the Devonshire coast. Train manager Sandra and her hospitality team help a passenger surprise his wife of 40 years with a special anniversary present, while executive chef Nick creates a sumptuous five-course meal and learner steam train driver Ian clocks up more training hours passing alongside the red rock coast

programme.title: Ancient Egypt by Train with Alice Roberts
programme.desc: Having seen the treasures of Tutankhamun in a Cairo Museum, Alice takes the train to Luxor to see his tomb and his mummified body in the Valley of the Kings. She also takes a walk along the Avenue of the Sphinxes and catches up with an old friend who's using satellite technology to find hundreds of previously undiscovered burial sites

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Bolton-based bricklayer Paul Rimmer, who has spent his career restoring and renovating Victorian terrace houses, sets his sights on constructing a state-of-the-art home on a budget of £350,000. However, instead of using the construction materials he has spent the past 40 years mastering, he has opted to build his new home from wood. Roping in his wife Carol, daughter Abby and a selection of favoured workmates, Paul and his team begin work on the ultra-modern, five-bedroom build, and Kevin McCloud reveals how extreme weather, exhaustion, and rapidly dwindling funds place the entire project in jeopardy

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: Some of the nation's top personalities turn their hand to being the country's most opinionated viewers as they critique the week's TV. Giving their view on the most talked about television of the week are Davina McCall with her partner Michael Douglas, Katherine Ryan and her husband Bobby, Rob Beckett and Tom Allen, Tom Grennan and his dad Martin, naturalist Chris Packham with his step-daughter Megan, Big Zuu, Hyder and Tubsey, Paul Sinha and husband Olly, Nick Grimshaw and his niece Liv, Shaun Ryder and Bez, Martin and Roman Kemp, and married couple Clare Balding and Alice Arnold

programme.title: Britain's Most Expensive Houses
programme.desc: Documentary following the brokers at UK Sotheby's International Realty. The super prime property market is booming and competition to court ultra-high-net-worth individuals with money to spend is fierce. This programme features a grade I listed terraced home for sale overlooking Regents Park Lake. Built in 1822 and designed by renowned Regency architect John Nash, it's worth an eye-watering £29million, making it one of the most expensive homes in the UK. Also in London, managing director of UK Sotheby's International Realty Guy is invited to sell a rather unusual houseboat boasting five bedrooms and three bathrooms

programme.title: Moors Murders
programme.desc: Analysis of never-before-seen letters from Ian Brady and Myra Hindley, written over their five decades in prison, and personal accounts from those who knew them. The first episode features an eyewitness account of the last murder from Myra Hindley's brother-in-law David Smith, and contributions from 1960s pop singer Janie Jones, who befriended Hindley in prison and conducted a 40-year-long correspondence with both Hindley and Brady

programme.title: Extraordinary Escapes with Sandi Toksvig
programme.desc: Sandi and comedian, actor and writer Roisin Conaty explore Wales from the Pembrokeshire Coast to the English boarder staying in the best retreats the country has to offer. Starting with Seren Mor near the Nevern Estuary, Roisin is blown away by the contemporary architecture and dogs on the beach. Electric bikes take the pair over to Powys where they stay at the Hergest Lee Cabin and Lean-To, styled with quirky design and mid-century furnishings. Finally, the pair top off their escape in Moor Tower, a refurbished folly by Hay on Wye just a mile from the Welsh boarder boasting views of the Black Mountains, The Brecon Beacons and the Wye Valley

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jon Richardson and Joe Wilkinson take on Lee Mack and Katherine Ryan in the comedy words-and-numbers game, while the Brett Domino Trio join Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. Hosted by Jimmy Carr, with Rachel Riley looking after the numbers and letters

programme.title: Wonders of the World I Can't See
programme.desc: Blind comedian Chris McCausland explores some of the world's most iconic landmarks to discover things that the ordinary traveller might miss. Chris is joined by Harry Hill for a trip to the Acropolis in the Greek capital Athens. They soak up some local culture, including sea fishing, pottery making, olive oil tasting and Greek drama lessons, and even try their hand at a few Olympic sports in the iconic Panathenaic Stadium

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Richard and Harriet Secular pride themselves on their high-end rooms at the Royal George in Tintern in Monmouthshire - and the guests are not disappointed, with plenty of praise for the hosts throughout the two days. Will the feedback mirror their experience?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Actor Patrick Fysh hosts the fourth dinner party in Kent, and hopes to impress with his molecular gastronomy. However, Michael Dodsworth is confused by the 21-year-old's interest in surrealist feminist art, and Nina Gaskell is left speechless by risque pictures of his girlfriend

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In West Yorkshire, Stacey and Tom kick things off with a traditional European menu, with Stacey forced to confront her fears and handle chicken livers for the first time. Robin and wife Kaz steal the night with terrible jokes and comedy false teeth, while bemused Kiwi couple Leigh and Toni wonder at some of the humour. The second day sees Leigh and Toni preparing their Italian-themed menu in the tiny galley of their barge, but the biggest worry is the rabbit main course. Finally Robin and Kaz host, confident the meaty menu they have in mind will be a winner, along with their planned conga

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Presenter Sara Damergi helps Chris Grandison and his grandmother Patricia Blythe search for a holiday home in Malta. Patricia and her late husband lived on the island many years ago when he served in the Armed Forces, and her grandson hopes to find a property with rental potential on a budget of £70,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Luke Doonan and Laura Hamilton search for a second home in the Lake District and Sitges, Spain, on a budget of £250,000 for a pair who want to rent out the property when they are not using it. They try to help Stephen and Stuart decide whether to buy a holiday apartment abroad, or stay in the UK

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies is with house-hunter Marion in the coastal region of Puglia in the south of Italy, helping her buy a holiday home she can enjoy with her daughter, friends and family

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Country Lives
programme.desc: Dave and Lynn are making progress on their farmhouse renovations and Susie and Bill start making plans for their garden

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: In Somerset, Simon O'Brien and Henry Cole meet sisters Katherine and Bex, who run an animal sanctuary and a theatre props business. Restorations and upcycles include work on a giant guinea pig hutch

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Van driver Annie Wroe serves up a racy-themed menu for the opening dinner party in Plymouth, with the starter named Something Fishy Going On, a main course called Saucy Pork Loins with Veg and a dessert of Chocolicious with a Twist. However, former Navy officer Charlie Brunel refuses to eat the main course and all the guests are alarmed by the after-dinner entertainment

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Car service manager Suzanne Hyde hosts the second party in Plymouth, and after the heated exchanges of the previous dinner, prepares for another tense evening. She hopes to win over her fellow diners with her simple style of cooking, but the food is overshadowed when she argues with previous hostess Annie Wroe

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The third day of the competition in Plymouth. Former sailor Tony Wade thinks of himself as the best cook in the group, and prepares a range of complicated dishes to prove it. He also hopes to ease relations between Annie Wroe and Suzanne Hyde by sitting them next to each other, which is a risky undertaking

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Recruitment manager Sarah Joy hosts the penultimate dinner party in Plymouth. She hopes to create a happier atmosphere after a series of disagreements, but outspoken guest Suzanne has other ideas. Later, an after-dinner disco gives Charlie the opportunity to perform a Scottish jig

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Former Navy soldier Charlie Brunel hosts the final dinner party in Plymouth, and plans to get his guests into the party mood by organising a pirate-themed evening, complete with fancy dress and a fish dish, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies is with house-hunter Marion in the coastal region of Puglia in the south of Italy, helping her buy a holiday home she can enjoy with her daughter, friends and family

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Nottingham-based social worker Sheila fell in love with the lifestyle that Spain offers in 2016 and now after selling her home in the UK has decided it's time to find her very own holiday home in the sun. She brings along her best friend of 43 years Rose to help her decide. Laura Hamilton has five impressive apartments to show for her £55,000 budget, but whether Sheila and Rose will be sufficiently impressed to put in an offer remains to be seen

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil catch up with former house-hunters who were looking for a new start. In 2012, Kirsten and Scott moved from Kirkcaldy after Scott was made redundant and secured a new job in Aberdeen. Kirstie managed to find them a rural cottage close to Scott's work. Nine years, several moves and a few job changes later, the pair are back in Kirkcaldy where Kirstie catches up with them. In 2020, Digi had a big budget and even bigger expectations. She was looking for a country pile near London with outbuildings for both her businesses that was close to daughter Emily's school and full of character. Having a medical condition meant her new home also had to be fully accessible. Kirstie rose to the challenge but Digi realised if she wanted to find the perfect property she would have to expand her search. Two years later, Phil visits Digi in her new home in Abingdon to see if she managed to find her dream place

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Cameras follow junior doctor Ming, who for the first time in his career carries out a needle aspiration on a 19-year-old patient brought into A&E with a collapsed lung. A woman who is 17 weeks pregnant falls down the stairs, and fears the accident may lead to a possible miscarriage. She recounts her struggles to conceive, and fears that if this pregnancy fails, she may never have a child

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jon Richardson and Joe Wilkinson take on Lee Mack and Katherine Ryan in the comedy words-and-numbers game, while the Brett Domino Trio join Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. Hosted by Jimmy Carr, with Rachel Riley looking after the numbers and letters

programme.title: First Man (2018)
programme.desc: A look at the life of astronaut Neil Armstrong, from his early days in 1961 as a NASA test pilot. By the late 1960s, as he becomes emotionally distant from his family, he embarks on a space mission that leads to him becoming the first man to walk on the moon. Director Damien Chazelle's Oscar-winning drama based on the book by James R Hansen, starring Ryan Gosling and Claire Foy

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of Bedfordshire Police, from the cells at Luton to the operational heart of major investigations

programme.title: Wonders of the World I Can't See

programme.title: Britain's Most Expensive Houses
programme.desc: Broker Constance is on a mission to get the listing for Laura Comfort's £12.5million home as the celebrity singer wants to downsize to a £4million pad in Chelsea. Managing director Guy values a quaint Tudor cottage in Henley on Thames - a little corner of paradise that owner Brian is selling for the not insignificant sum of £1.75million. It boasts a swimming pool and a shower in a former phone box

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Michael Dodsworth hosts the final dinner party in Medway, Kent, and decides to keep his menu simple by preparing Thai chicken cakes, jambalaya and raspberry and lime sorbet. He also arranges games including pinata, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Teams from Bradford and Huddersfield compete, with married couple Sophie and Harj kicking things off with a Mexican menu - if Harj can find his way around the kitchen. Super-competitive Richard and Libby attempt a more formal menu of British favourites. Finally, butcher Sean serves up a meat feast, but is it too much for squeamish Sophie? And can Sean and Jane's evening of laughs scoop them the prize?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: London couple Bob and Annette Roberts have been holidaying in Grenada for 25 years and now, with retirement on the horizon, they're looking to invest £225,000 in a holiday home. Adrian Simpson shows them round a selection of what is available on the market

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Property experts Luke Doonan and Laura Hamilton provide the know-how to people facing the dilemma of whether to buy in the UK or abroad. Andrew and Lesley Breeze cannot decide whether to start their new B&B business in the Lake District or move to the East Pyrenees in France, but have decided that their destination must be hilly having lived on the flatlands of Norfolk for so long

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton goes house-hunting around the Messinia Peninsula in Greece with Martin and Sonia from Bristol. The couple have been travelling extensively around Greece for many years since their first trip 36 years ago, and now are dreaming of retiring there permanently. Utilising their maximum budget of £125,000, Laura lines up five options to show them, hopeful one will prove to be the pair's 'forever home'

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Country Lives
programme.desc: Susie and Bill soldier on with their barn conversion, but feel the pressure to make it liveable quickly so they can move in

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Aspiring glamour model Annierose Crone hosts the first dinner party in Coventry, and prepares a menu featuring sausages in the starter, main course and dessert. Her guests are cleaner and wrestler Joanne Edwards, pub manager Tony Jackson, chocolatier Chris Tabor and salon owner Michelle Russell

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Master chocolatier Chris Tabor hosts the second dinner party in Coventry, but his elaborate menu provokes some mixed reactions from the others, and he ends up falling out with pub landlord Tony Jackson

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Part-time pro-wrestler Joanne Edwards hosts the third party in Coventry. Her risky strategy is to prepare dishes she has never made before, and the lack of knowledge shows when she manages to injure herself twice while cooking the meal

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Publican Tony Jackson hosts the fourth dinner party in Coventry. His guests have high expectations for his pub-themed event and while Michelle Russell thinks he may be the man to beat, Chris Tabor tries to spoil the evening by criticising every aspect of the meal

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hair salon owner Michelle Russell hosts the final dinner party in Coventry, and the evening begins with champagne in the garden, but the proceedings take a turn for the worse when Tony Jackson decides to irritate the other guests and Joanne Edwards makes a shocking announcement. programme.title: Five Star Kitchen: Britain's Next Great Chef
programme.desc: The six remaining chefs are split into two teams to create a bespoke and opulent menu for a VIP client staying in the Langham's most expensive luxury suite, which costs £25,000 a night. The winning team are given the day off, while the losers face a challenge in which they each have to produce a luxury five-star breakfast tray in keeping with their restaurant concept

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Perplexing cases from the files of Bedfordshire Police. When a couple were woken by what sounded like a break-in at their rural property, the husband set out in pursuit of what he perceived were burglars on motorbikes. Minutes later, police received a call reporting a devastating collision. At the scene two men were still trapped under a vehicle, both of them have apparently suffered critical injuries. Detective Inspector Grant Maxted investigates what happened at the devastating crash and what lay behind it

programme.title: Moors Murders
programme.desc: Following the arrest of Brady for a single murder, police discover a tape recording of a 10-year-old girl being tortured and realise they are investigating a string of murders. Eyewitness Clive Entwistle describes the first police search of the moors above Manchester. He was present when the remains of the girl on the tape were found, and explains how police used photographs of the serial-killing couple posing on the moors to locate the body of the third known victim, a 12-year-old boy

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: A rolling cast of famous faces, some of Britain's best loved personalities, turn their hand to being the country's most opinionated viewers, sharing their opinions on what they have been watching during the week

programme.title: Traffic Cops

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Cameras focus on 82-year-old Welsh valley girl Val, now of the Costa del Sol, where her spirit, character and fashion forward wardrobe hit the streets enjoying a walking tour with her close friend and 'silver fox' Alan. Together they share the secrets of their beautiful home town of Mijas

programme.title: Shoplifters & Scammers: At War with the Law
programme.desc: Undercover detectives Steve and Adam are on patrol in London's West End when they get a call from an Oxford Street department store where six women are on a shoplifting spree

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: A retired secretary has to visit her tenant in prison to retake possession of her buy-to-let flat. A Manchester mother applies to the housing charity Shelter for help because she is convinced the property she is renting is making her children ill

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Highlights of the documentary giving an insight into the working life of officers patrolling the nation's roads as they combine modern technology and old-fashioned methods to bring criminals to justice. Officers pursue a drug runner down one of the UK's busiest motorways, and a drug deal results in a white-knuckle race through Bradford's back streets

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston presents an edition focusing on the hunt for disqualified, unlicensed and uninsured drivers. In Bradford, officers from the West Yorkshire Safer Roads team pursue a desperate and disqualified driver through the city streets, while a member of the public is forced into making a citizen's arrest when another banned motorist attempts to flee the scene of a crash. In York, a pensioner is knocked down in a hit-and-run incident and an urgent search for the culprit gets under way

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Lee is confronted by a particularly mouthy motorist who does not know when to call it a day, and Liam arrests a man who denies carrying out a shocking attack, despite the CCTV evidence. Tasers are drawn after a van driver causes carnage and a wanted man holes up in a loft and refuses to come quietly, resulting in a shower of loft insulation, pepper spray and abuse

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Spike takes the lead against a runaway car thief in one of the most challenging pursuits ever, while Liam investigates a gang of suspected drug dealers from Nottingham. Elsewhere, supposedly straightforward stop for Jacko snowballs into a late-night showdown with an aggressive youngster

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Paul 'Jacko' Jackson is forced to draw his Taser, while dog handler Mo pursues two stolen cars through the streets of Middlesbrough. Steve runs after an uninsured driver who has ditched his car, and Halloween turns from fright night to fight night

programme.title: Car Pound Cops: Give Me My Car Back!

However, at the point of death, he is transported back in time to relive his last day again. As he faces the same battle over and over again, the experience he gains turns him into the ultimate warrior. Sci-fi adventure based on Hiroshi Sakurazaka's novel All You Need Is Kill, starring Tom Cruise, Emily Blunt and Brendan Gleeson

Hard-hitting and emotional series chronicling the life and crimes of the New York Police Department, starring Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.title: NCIS

The 200th episode of the crime drama, starring Mark Harmon

programme.title: NCIS

Vance brings in Tony's ex-fiancee, journalist Wendy Miller, who claims the victim had been trying to expose a scandal, and as the team pursues the case, a real-estate scam is uncovered. Guest starring Perrey Reeves (Entourage)

programme.title: Blue Bloods

programme.title: Blue Bloods

Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Sarah Walsh wakes up from a night of partying believing she has been raped for a second time and calls Detective Benson, who handled her previous case. The search for Sarah's attacker leads the police to a smooth-talking cyber mogul who preys on vulnerable girls and bribes them for their silence

Guest starring Jamie Lee Curtis

programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures

programme.title: Legend of the Dragon
programme.desc: A dragon-beast comes to life when the Emperor of the Darkest Yin takes over Ling's body

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world

programme.title: Sooty
programme.desc: Sooty, Sweep and Soo become convinced Richard is getting married, and plan to give him a day to remember

programme.title: Sooty
programme.desc: Sweep is scared of water and cannot reach his frisbee when it lands in the sea

programme.title: Kong: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Kong, Jason, jungle girl Lua, fun-loving Tann and wise Dr. Jenkins take on power-hungry scientists, ferocious prehistoric creatures and incredible magical beings to protect their unique island home

programme.title: Hell Below
programme.desc: Event-based series charting the stealth game of subsea warfare, tracking the dramatic narrative from contact to attack of the greatest submarine patrols of World War II

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton sets off from Mallaig to explore a group of islands famous for their unusual names - Rum, Muck and Eigg. Along the way, he meets the real 'Lord Muck', visits the dramatic Kinloch Castle and joins the residents of Eigg as they celebrate their community buyout

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton continues his island-hopping odyssey, setting sail on an island pilgrimage in the footsteps of saints, visiting Lismore, Colonsay and Oronsay. He hears the story of Saint Moluag, who established a monastery on Lismore, joins writer Alexander McCall Smith on his yacht, and uncovers the secrets revealed by a Viking ship burial on Colonsay

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: The pilgrims face danger in a volcanic land prone to earthquakes caused by the constant quarrelling of a catfish demon and a shape-changing demon able to assume any form

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: Maya's shapeshifting abilities cause havoc, while the Eagle One gets lost in space. Starring Martin Landau, Barbara Bain and Catherine Schell

programme.title: Fitzwilly (1967)
programme.desc: A loyal butler helps his impoverished, eccentric employer make donations to her favourite charities by leading a double life as a master criminal. Comedy, with Dick Van Dyke, Edith Evans, Barbara Feldon and Sam Waterston

programme.title: Tiger in the Smoke (1956)
programme.desc: A criminal gang made up of war veterans is forced by a murderous escaped convict to go in search of hidden treasure. Crime thriller, starring Donald Sinden and Muriel Pavlow

programme.title: My Greek Odyssey
programme.desc: Peter Maneas journeys through some of the most spectacular Greek islands, exploring the rich culture, history and food of Greece while meeting the locals and those who live there

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: Ainsley's Gourmet Express
programme.desc: The chef visits the seaside, where he prepares hot smoked salmon, garlic and bay roasted cod and lobster

programme.title: Big City Life
programme.desc: Documentary following a group of West Ham FC fans who have formed friendships by wearing colourful shirts when they support their team in the stands

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels
programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: Growing Up Poor
programme.desc: First of a two-part documentary about youngsters facing poverty, beginning with three teenage girls who are on the cusp of adulthood and are all surviving on less than £10 a day. Bridie's ambition to join the Army depends on her staying out of trouble with the police, while 16-year-old Amber has fallen pregnant, and Shelby is currently on benefits, but hopes the work placement she is on will develop into a full-time job

programme.title: Tender Mercies (1982)
programme.desc: An alcoholic failed country singer wakes up broke and hungover in a tiny Texas motel. Taking a job at the establishment, he ultimately marries the widowed owner and becomes a father figure to her son. However, when the chance to return to his musical career beckons, he is tempted to abandon his new family. Drama, starring an Oscar-winning Robert Duvall alongside Tess Harper and Ellen Barkin

programme.title: Winter of Our Dreams (1981)
programme.desc: Prostitute Lou encounters her dead friend's ex, who wants to discover why she committed suicide. A relationship develops between them, but when Lou acquires her friend's diary, she realises to her horror that she is repeating the mistakes of the past. Drama, with Judy Davis and Bryan Brown

programme.title: Quest Boxing League
programme.desc: Welcome to the UK's toughest boxing competition, where aspiring young boxers battle it out inside the ring for their chance to be crowned the Quest Boxing League Champion.

programme.title: Ainsley's Gourmet Express
programme.desc: The chef visits the seaside, where he prepares hot smoked salmon, garlic and bay roasted cod and lobster

programme.desc: A digest of news and events from across London from the past few days.

programme.desc: 'Current affairs affecting Londoners today and a look at the latest shows and films in the capital.

programme.title: Sooty
programme.desc: Further adventures with ever-popular puppet pals Sooty, Sweep and Soo

programme.title: Sooty
programme.desc: Mr Slater comes for tea, but the gang's plan to clean the house ahead of his visit goes awry

programme.title: Kong: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Kong, Jason, jungle girl Lua, fun-loving Tann and wise Dr. Jenkins take on power-hungry scientists, ferocious prehistoric creatures and incredible magical beings to protect their unique island home

programme.title: Hell Below
programme.desc: The stealth game of subsea warfare, tracking the dramatic narrative from contact to attack of the greatest submarine patrols of the Second World War

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert visits the Weald on the Kent-Sussex border, where he observes herds of fallow deer with fawns in the medieval royal hunting park of Ashdown Forest, and joins ranger Alice Parfitt to explore the sights the heathland has to offer. Landscape archaeologist Nicola Bannister helps him understand the role of the iron industry in shaping the area

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert recalls some of his favourite moments from the programme. Beginning the series on the Isle of Mull, he swam with the world's second-largest fish, the basking shark, and observed white-tailed eagle chicks in their nest. He then explored the Yorkshire Dales and Salisbury Plain, took a trip down the River Wye and studied the wildlife of Scotland's west coast. There were also visits to the Weald, and the Isle of Wight, where Ray had the perfect opportunity to film red squirrels and badgers

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels
programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: A routine check-up brings shocking news for Molly, but Kate is delighted to get an interview for a place at Oxford University. William is deeply moved when local vicar John Castlemaigne asks him to arrange the funeral of his own daughter. Mary takes up the cudgels for a blind couple who want a home birth for their first child, in spite of the consultant's advice to keep the mother-to-be in hospital. Martin Clunes and Julie Graham star

programme.title: The King and Four Queens (1956)
programme.desc: A gambler visits a ranch owned by the mother of four infamous outlaw brothers. He hopes to discover the location of buried treasure stolen by the criminal family, but finds himself fending off the advances of the bandits' seductive wives, all of whom hope to escape their absent husbands and make off with the loot. Western, with Clark Gable, Eleanor Parker and Jo Van Fleet

programme.title: Fitzwilly (1967)
programme.desc: A loyal butler helps his impoverished, eccentric employer make donations to her favourite charities by leading a double life as a master criminal. Comedy, with Dick Van Dyke, Edith Evans, Barbara Feldon and Sam Waterston

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Ainsley's Gourmet Express
programme.desc: The chef visits the seaside, where he prepares hot smoked salmon, garlic and bay roasted cod and lobster

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered.

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton continues his island-hopping odyssey, exploring the islands scattered in the Firth of Forth. He discovers these seemingly peaceful islands have a dramatic history of warfare, from medieval English raids on Inchcolm to the first air-raid attack on Britain above Inchgarvie. Paul learns about the strategic importance of Inchkeith's defences during two world wars before heading to the Bass Rock to learn more about the history of prisoners incarcerated on the island, with 160,000 gannets for company

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: For his final tour, Paul Murton goes over the sea to Skye, where he visits the home of writer and naturalist Gavin Maxwell, before scaling the famous Cuillin mountain, Am Basteir. On the nearby Isle of Raasay he learns the amazing true story of the crofter Calum Macleod, who between 1964 and 1974 singlehandedly built a road to connect his isolated community

programme.title: Kate Humble: Off the Beaten Track
programme.desc: The presenter, accompanied by Welsh sheepdog Teg, continues her journey across the remote Welsh countryside by exploring mid-Wales. In Ponterwyd, the duo herd sheep for the market, and Kate sees first-hand the price disparity between what farmers get for their sheep and what consumers pay. At the Teifi Pools she discovers that Wales is a world leader in protecting its dark skies, and along the River Elan gets hooked on fly fishing. Later, in Llangammarch Wells, Teg has a family reunion, meeting three of her five pups to see if they can earn their Welsh sheepdog credentials

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tour of West Greenwich for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: The Iceman Cometh (1973)
programme.desc: Harrowing film adaptation of Eugene O'Neill's play, depicting patrons of a saloon who sit and contemplate their lost faith and dreams _ only to be brought back to reality by the arrival of a mysterious salesman. Starring Lee Marvin, Fredric March, Robert Ryan and Jeff Bridges

programme.title: The Mirror Crack'd (1980)
programme.desc: Miss Marple investigates a murder on a film set starring feuding Hollywood stars Marina Rudd and Lola Brewster. When a local woman dies after drinking a poisoned cocktail made for Marina, everyone assumes the actress was the intended victim because she had received death threats. However, the sleuthing spinster is not convinced. Agatha Christie mystery, with Angela Lansbury, Elizabeth Taylor, Kim Novak and Rock Hudson

programme.title: Sooty
programme.desc: Richard makes doughnuts to sell in the park, but runs out of eggs. The local farmer and his chickens try to help

programme.title: Sooty
programme.desc: Soo has an accident on her roller-skates and needs to stay in bed. Sooty and Sweep are on hand to bake her a cake - but they only have eggshells and pepper

programme.title: Kong: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Kong, Jason, jungle girl Lua, fun-loving Tann and wise Dr. Jenkins take on power-hungry scientists, ferocious prehistoric creatures and incredible magical beings to protect their unique island home

programme.title: Hell Below
programme.desc: The stealth game of subsea warfare, tracking the dramatic narrative from contact to attack of the greatest submarine patrols of the Second World War

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring
programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring
programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: Kate Humble: Off the Beaten Track
programme.desc: The presenter, accompanied by Welsh sheepdog Teg, continues her journey across the remote Welsh countryside by exploring mid-Wales. In Ponterwyd, the duo herd sheep for the market, and Kate sees first-hand the price disparity between what farmers get for their sheep and what consumers pay. At the Teifi Pools she discovers that Wales is a world leader in protecting its dark skies, and along the River Elan gets hooked on fly fishing. Later, in Llangammarch Wells, Teg has a family reunion, meeting three of her five pups to see if they can earn their Welsh sheepdog credentials

programme.title: Big City Life
programme.desc: The lives of three artistic brothers, a drummer, a sculpture and a DJ

programme.title: Mudlarking the Thames
programme.desc: Nicola White unearths the river's historical treasures

programme.title: Tiger in the Smoke (1956)
programme.desc: A criminal gang made up of war veterans is forced by a murderous escaped convict to go in search of hidden treasure. Crime thriller, starring Donald Sinden and Muriel Pavlow

programme.title: The Vicious Circle (1957)
programme.desc: A surgeon is horrified to find an actress has been murdered in his home, and calls the police. However, they soon discover the murder weapon in his car, leaving the finger of suspicion pointing straight at him. A desperate race against time ensues, as the medic tries to clear his name and find the real killer. Thriller, starring John Mills, Lisa Daniely, Derek Farr, Roland Culver and Noelle Middleton

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing Crystal Palace and Shoreditch. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Kate Humble: Off the Beaten Track
programme.desc: The presenter, accompanied by Welsh sheepdog Teg, continues her journey across the remote Welsh countryside by exploring mid-Wales. In Ponterwyd, the duo herd sheep for the market, and Kate sees first-hand the price disparity between what farmers get for their sheep and what consumers pay. At the Teifi Pools she discovers that Wales is a world leader in protecting its dark skies, and along the River Elan gets hooked on fly fishing. Later, in Llangammarch Wells, Teg has a family reunion, meeting three of her five pups to see if they can earn their Welsh sheepdog credentials

programme.title: Big City Life
programme.desc: The lives of three artistic brothers, a drummer, a sculpture and a DJ

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: Tripitaka and the gang help a man who's been digging a tunnel through a mountain for 22 years to provide an easier route for travellers

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: The day of Kate's Oxford interview dawns, but Mary's support is short-lived when she has to rush back to London to help a teenage mother hiding an important secret. William is put under pressure by Billy Two Hats to commit to the band and later faces a difficult situation at work when he has to consider the possibility his client was the victim of a mercy killing. Brendan gives Reuben a frosty reception when he turns up unannounced and Molly begins her treatment. Romantic drama, starring Peta Cornish, Julie Graham, Martin Clunes, Ricci Mcleod and Paterson Joseph

programme.title: Kill Ben Lyk (2018)
programme.desc: When three people with the same name are murdered in London in 24 hours, Scotland Yard attempts to gather all the other Ben Lyks located in the city until they can figure out who's after them and why. Director Erwan Marinopoulos's comedy thriller, starring Martyn Ford, Eugene Simon and Bronson Webb

programme.title: Jack & Sarah (1995)
programme.desc: A lawyer's life is turned upside down by his wife's death in childbirth, leaving him to pick up the pieces and raise their daughter with the help of an unconventional American nanny. This emotional romantic comedy strikes a fair balance between sentiment and slush. Richard E Grant, Samantha Mathis, Judi Dench and Ian McKellen are among the experienced cast

programme.title: Honour (2014)
programme.desc: A Muslim girl is forbidden from seeing her boyfriend by her traditional parents, but she defies them and the couple run away together. The girl's mother feels the family has been dishonoured, and hires a mysterious bounty hunter to track her down and carry out punishment for her disobedience. Thriller, starring Paddy Considine and Aiysha Hart

Only two teams then make it through to the World Cup finals

programme.desc: Manchester United v Tottenham Hotspur in the 2008/09 final. Spurs were managed by Harry Redknapp and had a strong run that led them to the final of the competition, having beaten the likes of Newcastle, Liverpool and Watford in previous rounds. The Red Devils had beaten Middlesbrough, Queens Park Rangers and Blackburn Rovers in the early rounds, before beating Derby County 4-3 on aggregate
